name: Susan Raymond
text: Horrible experience!  Had a great rate 13-17 March booked a month in advance.  Called to add an extra day and clerk said it would change my rate and make the reservation double.  I said no thank you.  Came in on the 13th and they said I had no reservation for 13-17 March that "Travelocity" had changed it to the 12-17 Mar and now today they had no car for me! I had an email with the confirmation for 13-17 March and nothing else from Travelocity or Hertz saying anything had been changed!! Clerk made me feel like I was crazy. He did call Enterprise at the Airport to see if they had cars and they did so  I left and rented from Enterprise.  When I chatted with "Hertz Online Chat" they told me clerk had changed the reservation when I called, possibly by accident when checking the rates?? but did not tell me or send a confirmation email. I have screen shots from my Hertz Online Chat.  I know human error exists but the clerk made me think I was crazy for showing up on the 13th. At least the online chat helped me understand there was a MISTAKE BY HERTZ not me or Travelocity. So disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to rate & tell us about your experience with us, Susan. We hate to see that your experience was less than satisfactory. We hope you will give us a chance to provide you with a more positive experience in the future. We appreciate the feedback, and we will be sharing this with our team. -Bob

The Enterprise a couple of blocks away will help you through!

resp.text: Angelia, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We hate to hear that you're disappointed with us. We'd like to make this right , please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam

text: I would recommend against renting a Thrifty vehicle at the Mobile Airport. I set my rental car pick up for 6:00 PM and did not have a vehicle until 11:12 PM. At the Mobile airport, the service desks for Hertz, Thrifty, and Dollar are combined at certain hours. I was told that not enough employees were available to clean and prepare vehicles, causing me to wait nearly five and a half hours for a vehicle previously booked and paid for. I will not be renting a vehicle from this location again and strongly recommend against anyone else doing so.

name: Jonathan Bernstein
text: My flight was supposed to land at 11:20 pm into mobile airport, however, the flight was going to be delayed. I realized the business hours for thrfity were only until midnight so I called the local mobile, al thrifty counter around 10pm yesterday and spoke to someone (her name sounded like monique). She promised me that there is someone there at all times even when the car rental companies are closed, essentially a common person shared amongst all the rental car agencies to help travelers rent a car in this situation (when flights are delayed after business hours). When I got there I was informed that she simply lied and no person exists. The local police, airport customer service manager, and lost baggage desk all confirmed the same. At that point I was about to wait till 7am until the counter opened but was infromed instead that a fellow traveler on my same place was willing to drive the 60 miles to my relative's house (by coincidence he happened to live near my destination).

Interestingly enough, the guy who dropped another car off in front of me complained to Avis as well saying his smelled like an ashtray.  When I returned my car and reported my experience, the girl at the counter made me write and explanation and would send to the manager.  Of course, I have not heard from Avis.  Will not be using Avis again.

If you could email me at socialinfo@avis.com with your rental agreement number, reference number 133118, and any additional details, I will be happy to document this situation, and assist. ~ Nick

name: Patricia Seymour
text: Love Gulf Coast Auto Group staff.  It’s the Audi that’s the problem.  I only have approximately 46K miles on the car.  She’s pretty.  But the convertible top has leaked since the purchase.  Then there have been so many problems with other parts, and a 3x AC problem/fix (qualifying it as a lemon), that it has been in the shop as much as it’s been with me.  I have a color-coded chart. When I let the “powers that be” at Audi know about the first few years of problems, they basically said, “FU with a smile”.  This car was actually built in Germany.  My German friends would be appalled.  They take their car quality very seriously.

name: Emily
text: I had a great experience purchasing my new car from Gulf Coast Auto Group. I highly recommend Mr. Kenny Cunningham. He was professional, honest, friendly, and made my buying experience easy and fast. All of the staff I spoke with were friendly and professional. I will use them in the future.

name: Ellie M
text: My service representative, Laura Collier, is wonderful! She always ensures that every issue is resolved. We have been extremely satisfied with the service that she and the mechanics at Audi of Mobile have provided to us over the past 5 years with our two Audis. My son took his Audi to another local repair shop and they caused damage to the vehicle because they lacked the knowledge and skills to properly perform the repairs. We then took his car to Audi of Mobile and they corrected everything! I will ONLY have my Audi Q5 serviced at Audi of Mobile.

name: Makenzie Brenner
text: I admit I was nervous to purchase a car online from a dealership over 6 hours away, but Gulf Coast Auto, specifically Devon made the experience seamless. Great communication, fantastic customer service and product knowledge. It was honestly the best experience I could’ve hoped for. 100% worth the road trip down and I am obsessed with my new car!

name: Queen Royalty
text: Everyone there is so nice and helpful. The finance department and the sales person (Alfredo Montes) made sure we understood the offer for our Volkswagen Atlas.

name: Myra C.
text: I went to Porsche of New Orleans and they were trying to blantantly make the 2018 Macan I wanted inaccessible. These fools really tried to make me put down 20,000 for a 500/month car payment. AVOID THAT DEALERSHIP AT ALL COST. They did not want to sell to a African American woman. Anyways, I found 2 more 2018 Macans in the Mobile area the same evening so we decided to go the next day. BEST DECISION EVER! I traded in my 2014 Infiniti Q60S that I loved dearly for a 2018 Porsche Macan! As a traveling CVOR tech, I needed more space and Kendarrius ensured that I didn’t leave without the vehicle that I wanted! I literally pulled up at 12:15 and was driving off at 4:30!! That was crazy fast, but if you are looking for an amazing deal on a beautiful car, THIS is the place to go. My monthly payment is 585/month on a PORSCHE!! That’s unheard of! They knew I wanted the car and this dealership made sure I left in it without having to eat bread and water for the next couple of years!

name: Monica Mingo
text:
My last two vehicles were Land Rovers.  I narrowed this purchase to an Audi or a Land Rover.  Devon took me on my test drives after donning a mask and I left with total knowledge of the Q5.  I went to the Land Rover dealership and was left knowing the same about their vehicles as I already knew upon arrival.  I was also unhappy with the attitude once I requested the salesman wear a mask during the test drive.

I called Devon the next morning to let him know that my husband and I would be returning and, when we got there, Devon was ready to go.  This young man has received several awards and accolades based on his performance and knowledge of Audi vehicles. I noticed two certifications on his desk.

Headed there my husband told me we were not going to buy the vehicle today and that this was simply an exploratory mission and that he wanted to test drive and then get the information in order to make a thoughtful decision.  After speaking with Devon at length, we ended up buying the Q5 same day.

Devon simply makes you feel good.  You sense his honesty right up front and there were no questions he couldn't answer.  We truly felt we were in extremely competant hands.

Thank you to Devon, the auto group, and for making it easy to jump the Land Rover ship and become a member of the Audi family.

text: Alfredo Montes was very helpful and nice. We ended up not being able to afford the car we wanted, but he never made us feel bad or embarrassed. And most importantly he didn't make us feel like we wasted his time. He went above and beyond for us and I really appreciate it! Thanks Alfredo!!😊😊😊

text: Purchased a VW all over the phone with Doug Klezmer. Doug took great care of me with a very smooth and convenient purchase. Very happy all the way around. Wish all car purchases were this easy! Thanks, Doug!

name: Michele
text: Me and my husband have had so many bad experiences here before the name change and new management or whatever. We always made appointments and would be there for 3 or 4 hours, we hated going there and the customer service was horrible! Today was the first time we've been there in at least a year or more and we were amazed at how much more better it is now. Our appointment was at 1 and we were out in less than an hour. Sean took great care of us and kept updated about what was going on with our car! The customer service was AMAZING! We have never experienced such great service like we did today. Thank you so much Laura and Sean and everyone for such a great experience and service we received today from you all!

name: Wayne Douglas
text: This dealership is very deceptive and dishonest. My salesperson was Alfredo. I specifically asked them to run my credit only through VW and stated that on the credit application. I found out a few days later that they had run it through all 3 credit bureaus instead and when I confronted Alfredo about it he said that that is just the way they do business and that my credit won't be hurt if I buy a car from them. My credit score dropped 24 points because of their unethical sales tactics. Most car manufacturers have their on inhouse financial arm so when you run your credit directly through them you only take an 8 point hit so that's why I made the specific request. Because I value my credit score so much it is very high and now I am reluctant to have it run at another dealership to get the car I want because of Alfredo and his companies dishonesty. This is just the worst fo many misleading statements Alfredo made to me. You're better off driving to one of the surrounding cities to buy your next vehicle than from here.

text:
We recently bought our first Volvo. AJ has gone out of his way to make this experience as seamless as possible. His knowledge about the car far surpasses any other dealership we have worked with.
The vehicle is amazing and capable of so many things.  Each time the technology out smarts me he is always available to answer my text or phone call and walk me through it.
I just appreciate the extra effort he always goes to to make us feel valuable. I love my Volvo and don’t plan on going anywhere else for my future vehicles.

I believe we got a quality vehicle and a reasonable price. I know she will be thinking of her buying experience and the welcoming employees whenever she drops the top this summer!

name: Edward Thomas
text: Gulf Coast Auto Group should change their name again, because of one simple question- do you give military discounts? No one in the service department knew or was unwilling to give at least 10% off. The parts department gave 10% off for military when I purchased 4 spark plug not less than 15 minutes laters. Military service people active and retired I will inform you don't buy anything from there without a discount 10% or higher, & at this point it should be higher.

text:
THIS THE PLACE!!
Considering a new car, this is the place! My husband and I bought 12 cars in our lifetime - this experience was by far the most professional/personable buying experience. The consultant, Santwan, was knowledgeable beyond measure, unlike the run-of-the-mil hunting salesman. The entire experience, from consultant, to floor manager [John], to Finance [Danny], to the GM [Mark].  Wow, treatment like the customer is a REAL PERSON not just a customer buying one of their cars - really, they have hearts and personality? We couldn't believe the care and the detail in service.  You go Gulf Coast Auto Group!!

Ashley Allen
Business Development Director

From that point we worked with Brittany Smith! She was a pleasure to do business with. Brittany was very friendly, knowledgeable and never made us feel rushed or pressured. We couldn’t be happier with our new car and the service we received at Gulf Coast Auto Group.

name: Jennifer Jenkins
text:
Having a car reserved for a month obviously didn't mean anything to this location. It was a good thing I called the morning of my reservation to make sure they had the car I needed because they did not. I was to pick up a full size SUV at noon and by 3 pm I still did not have a car. Was told they had to go to another location to pick up a mini van because that was the only thing available. After I was told I could pick the car up at 2:30, putting me behind my schedule by 2 and a half hours already, I arrived at this location and was told that whoever went to pick up the car must have gotten lost on the way back because he was not back yet. Was asked to wait in the lobby which smelt like pure gasoline, and they would come get me as soon as he arrived. 30 minutes later still no one has come to get me and I walk back to the desk and ask if he has an update and he said No, that he might be out back. I then asked if he could check because I was 3 hours behind schedule already and still had a 4 hour drive ahead of me. He then ran to the "Back" and another guy, I'm assuming the person who got lost on the way back to the lot, came in about 10 minutes later and apologized and started the paperwork. The van was comfortable but not what I had requested a month in advance. And just FYI, I was also told by customer service that making a reservation does not guarantee you will get the vehicle you requested, just before she said she was transferring me and disconnected the line.
The day I was set to return the car, I received a phone call from someone at that location and was asked if I could return the vehicle earlier than requested because they had someone that needed that particular car and didn't have another in their fleet. First of all I would not call what they have a "fleet" of vehicles, it's more like 3 cars evidently. And second, NO! You didn't go out of your way for me to find the vehicle I had requested a month in advance. I called your customer service line after waiting for your to call me back for 4 hours and had them change it to a van and see if any locations had it. Then I called you and told you I had it changed and where it was located. But this is not the first time this has happened at this location. I gave you a second chance and you will not get a third. I will not rent from this company as a whole again. Very poor customer service.

resp.text: Jennifer Jenkins, we would like to look into this further. Please email care@enterprise.com with your contact information, your reservation or rental agreement number and all the details of your experience. Thanks. Chris M

text: I have rented twice from this Enterprise Rental location.  Both times I rented a mid-size SUV.  Both times I have had to deal with staff who were not assigned to that location and was only "helping out".  Both times I have had to wait well over 30 minutes for the staff to find a car for me and have it cleaned up enough to provide me with the car that I rented.  The vehicles were basically run through the car wash and then handed over to me.  They were not vacuumed and the windows looked like they had not been cleaned in months.  The second time I rented at this location, the vehicle only had 1/4 tank of gas when it was given to me.  Considering I was already almost an hour late departing due to waiting on a vehicle, this was just one more inconvenience. This location is inside a local car dealer and appears to be very busy.  Enterprise needs to commit to staffing this location appropriately with permanent staff and they also need to have more than one guy who cleans up the returned rental vehicles.  This location is not maintained like it is a professional, permanent location for Enterprise.  If you're going to advertise it on tv, then live it at your rental locations please.

name: Aprilmayorjune Usrey
text: Large selection, even on a last minute decision to rent.   Very helpful with insurance  needs.   I would recommend Bama Auto Rental to anyone needing to rent an automobile.

name: Kerri Cole
text: These ladies are the bomb. Go see them!!! Very friendly and was no hassle to get me in a vehicle. Enterprise did me dirty. These ladies took very good care of me. Treated me very well and was hassle free. I will only do business with them from now on. Truly the best car rental service in Decatur Al

name: Sasha Coffey
text: So, we paid for a rental over the weekend with pay now, and get to the location and there are no cars. There isn't a car anywhere, and the lady at the desk was HORRIBLY rude. There is no reason to treat people like that. I rent with Hertz for all my rentals, but I promise I'll never go through this company again. Terrible service!! Don't waste your time.

name: Sylvia Sutton
text:
Awesome customer service!
Thank u🖤💚💥

name: Show Stopper
text: This is only rated with one star because zero stars is not an option! I searched online for a rental at other other places and locations. I finally reserved an SUV on Hertz website at the Decatur location which is a little over 2 hours from me. 10 minutes after making my reservation I received an email of reservation confirmation. When it was my pickup time I showed up to be told THEY HAD NO CAR FOR ME. I told the lady there that I just drove over 2 HOURS with a 4 year old, 2 year old, and 5 week old because they confirmed my reservation. Her response? “Oh. We don’t have none.” No suggestion on where to go or who to call. Just Freakin “oh”?! This place is ridiculous. Please don’t waste your time.

name: Monica Sigler
text: My sister made reservations with them on 12 April 2021and was told she had could pick up on. Today she went by there and was told that a car was coming in but to call back at 2:30, still no car, she was told to call back at 4 no one answered, tried again at 4:30 they had closed. This is poor customer service.

name: Anya Jarman Davis
text: I rented a car for a week. Went to pick the car up,for them to tell me they don't have a car for me to rent. What's the point of making reservations.  Plus they already took the money out of my account a week ago. Unprofessional!! Will NEVER use again!

name: Ronnie Willis
text: I had a reservation for a one way rental and they waited until I was on my way to pick up the car to tell me that there was not one available.

name: COD Camper
text: No drop off box. This caused a HUGE problem because I had a flight to catch. Didn't even feel right leaving the keys out. ALL RENTAL LOCATIONS SHOULD HAVE A DROP OFF BOX. I was told that they have one, I walked around the building and didn't see anything.

name: Laurie Stadt
text: We reserved a vehicle in advance so we were sure that we'd have the vehicle for our trip. The day came to pick up the vehicle and what do you know, they don't have it! And all we got from them is "sorry there's nothing we can do" or "that vehicle is available in Huntsville or Birmingham airport but the cost you have already paid will not be honored and it's double the price". I hope no one else has these issues, we will never attempt to rent from them again. We were on the phone for hours! Not kidding actually hours trying to get some form of a resolution.

resp.text: Laurie, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz Car Rental.  We hate to hear that you're disappointed with us. We'd like to make this right , please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam ~Nikeya

name: Jana Kirkpatrick
text: Bad attitudes, rude customer service, took forever to get someone on the phone, masks required with and without medical conditions, my mother, who HAS medical conditions had to stand outside and wait while other customers were coming in and out without masks. The second time I’ve used them due to insurance coverage with the same issues.

name: Michael Hill
text:
I was sent by my vehicle insurance company to Hertz for a rental car when my vehicle needed repair. I should have taken it as a warning that another irate customer was there at the same time that I came to pick up a vehicle. Apparently the salesman was too tied up to explain the charges to me, so he got me in a car and let me drive away. When I returned the car I found out that he had charged an additional $300.00 on my credit card for "insurance."
They took the money off of my credit card before I had a chance to do anything about it. My insurance agent even called and tried to convince them that it was wrong that that since the whole thing was an insurance issue that they were not supposed to charge me that. but all to no avail. I will absolutely NEVER used hertz rental again. PERIOD.

resp.text: Michael, we regret that we did not meet your expectations during your rental experience. We have high standards that we strive to maintain. Our team would love the opportunity to review your concerns! Please reach out to us on Facebook messenger using the link: m.me/hertz  Thank you! -Emily

name: Kameron Bramlett
text:
I will never use again. What was supposed to be a $50 rental turned out to be $150. They charge me the $200 deposit TWICE. I did it through the website and they were supposed to be open till 12 Saturday and we’re closed so I got charged for Saturday and Sunday also. The car sat in there parking lot from Saturday at 10 am till Monday at 830 when I called for
Her to tell me they would be charging me. This is WRONG. They should have told me Thursdaywhen I picked it up  I had to return it to a different location.

name: Antonio Mojica
text: Jay was extremely helpful and friendly. He got me into a car quickly without any issues and took time to answer all my questions. I was here because my vehicle got totaled by a State Farm costumer and was able to get a rental car no more than 5 hours later.

name: Erica Sales
text: Paid for a week and was told I could keep it a week by the employee in Decatur. Was charged late fees by corporate and when I called corporate was told I would get a refund. Waited months and never got refunded. Then when I called back they said the refund wasn’t approved by the manager after being told I was being refunded. Then when I asked to speak to the manager I was told they were with another customer and would call me back. Well never received a call. Crooks!!!

name: Robyn Scott
text:
Do not go here  they are rude and never there and when they are not  there at drop off time so you 45 minutes late because they are dealing with other customers (I should say he because he was the only one in the store) they still charge you for another day and didn't even offer me to keep the car for another day since I was having to pay for it
Seriously use some one other than hertz in Decatur  my other 3 reviews have been deleted as soon as I put them up let's see how long this one makes it

text: Have nothing but great things to say. Worked with us to keep rates low. Very laid back. Thanks for a great experience!

resp.text: Cam , thank you for reaching out regarding your rental experience with us. We certainly would like our team to look into this experience further, if you could please message us via our Facebook link at m.me/Hertz. Thank you! - Justynne

resp.text: Christopher,  thank you for taking the time to write such a great review for us at Hertz Car Rental! We're delighted you had a great experience with our staff and hope to serve you again soon! -Emily

name: grits905
text: Horrible experience! We rent cars multiple times a year but this was our first time using Hertz in Decatur. Definitely our last as well. Was sent to the car wash twice and told we had to have our car detailed and ready for the next customer when we returned it because they didn’t want to have to do anything to it. In all our years of renting cars I’ve never even been asked to even vacuum our car out before returning. Was told they were going to charge me $200-$500 just to vacuum and wash our car. We had went on short in state trip and car was just average dirt from bugs on windshield and such. Very disappointed and unhappy. Do not go here!!

name: Dax Gillesie
text: Unacceptable. Had reserved a van for work DAYS ahead of time, showed up at 1:00 and was told there hasn’t been a van here all day. The guy who “helped” me said he was from corporate and there was nothing he could do unless I wanted to wait 3 hours on someone to return it from Birmingham. If zero stars were an option, that is what they deserve.

name: Anne A
text: Never trust the representative when changing reservations on 800 number. Always double check with local Hertz to make sure vehicle is available. They assured me full size SUV was there. They said no need to call. I called! No full size. Had to use midsize, but no reduction in cost. Infact they quoted me higher price. Also beware...although they offer roadside assistance...it is only from the closest airport. Had trouble last time, Sunday night, no Hertz open, airport 3 hours away. Had to risk traveling with engine light on in pouring rain. Do NOT rent a dodge charger. Dead battery 3 occasions. Only reason for 2 stars is cost comparison. Would have given it 1 star. Lastly, speak English 800 number reps! Talked to 3. All from obviously a call center across the ocean. SO FREAKING FRUSTRATED!!

name: Adel Al-bishari
text:
Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid ,
Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid ,
Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid , Avoid this location if you don’t want to have any issues getting the rental car you paid for. I had one of the worst experiences if it is not the worst in my life when I dealt with them. Absolutely 0% customer service, and they are not professional too.

name: Cyndi Kelly
text: Great place to rent a car. Very pleasant experience.

name: Cathy Stevens
text:
Because I'm disabled due to 7 spinal surgeries, we decided to rent a Minivan for a trip to Michigan, so it would be easier for me to get into it. I  made our reservation 25 days in advance & got confirmation stating we would get a Chrysler Pacifica or similar mini van. We get to the office only to find it closed with several customers waiting for it to open. Finally after 1 1/2 hrs, a Mr. Chestnut from corporate office in B'ham shows up.  As we start our process he tells us that he doesn't have a Minivan for us. Should have walked away right then, but we had already had our trip planned for 2 months. He then tells us that since we will be traveling through Nashville, that WE can stop @ the airport to see if they have a minivan.  WHAT?  His job is to call, Hertz had 25 days to do that. He then takes us out to a Toyota 4 runner. Crazy. I can't even step into a bathtub & he's telling me it won't be a problem for me to climb up. No compassion from this man.  My husband gets in, only to find the rear view mirror laying in the front seat. Mr. Chestnut said that a new windshield had been installed & the mirror fell off, but oh, you don't need a mirror for a trip over 700 miles. WHAT?  Then my husband starts the Toyota & the maintenance light comes on. Oh, Mr. Chestnut said the oil had just been changed & it would be okay. How does he know, he's from B'ham not Decatur.  Being extremely disappointed, but with no choice, I follow my husband back to Huntsville so we can get loaded up.
My husband said there is no way in hell he can drive to Michigan w/o rear view mirror, so I call Mr. Chestnut back to tell him my husband is going to glue the mirror back on. Nope, can't do that, my husband has to drive to SafeLite to have the mirror put on. Again, not our responsibility. We finally get loaded, I grab a step stool to aid with getting into this 4 Runner that is over a foot tall to get in, oh plus my 78 yr old Mother is also going on the trip, so everytime we stop, my husband has to get the stool out for me, then has to move it for my Mother just get us in & out.  While driving, my husband notices that every time he puts on the brakes, the vehicle pulls hard to the right.
Shouldn't be surprised, there are 3 different brands of tires. On left front is a reg SUV tire, right front is a full size truck tire. At least both rear tires are the same. I would NOT recommend this place at all. After we safety made it back home, and returned the 4 Runner, I received a survey from Hertz. I filled it out stating everything that I have said here & even complained about Mr. Chestnut, alot of good it did, as I received a standard reply & it was signed by Mr. Chestnut.  Don't you know that my complaint will never been seen by anyone else in the corporate office. I do have Mr. Chestnuts boss's number which I will be calling, plus Better Business Bureau and AAA with whom I went through to make this reservation.

name: Tammy Teters
text: Representatives were friendly but inefficient.  Called twice and was told I would receive a call back re: an insurance claim, with no return claim.  Called the local office back and no one could/would try to help, but referred me elsewhere without even trying to look at the account.  I was told that he "had an office full of people, and I would have to leave my name and number."  As a paying customer, I should not have to call back because another customer is more important.  You take care of the person you are with, providing them with the best service, and then move to the next.  When speaking with their claims dept, they could only refer me to the office or to the adjuster, who was naturally unavailable, and voicemail state she would return call "within 24 hours."  Terrible customer service all the way around.  We will not rent from here again.

name: Justin Klinkenberg
text: I set up an appointment to be picked up at the auto shop where I was having my car repaired for 9 am. I called that morning around 8:15 to confirm. The employee told me it would be around 9:15 am. He mentioned that if their driver's happen to be busy that they have an agreement with Lyft and they can get me one. Cool. I leave work to go drop off my car. At 9:20, I call them since they haven't arrived. The employee told me that he is the only one working today, and that his manager wouldn't allow him to lock up the store to pick me up until 11. First, why didn't they call me to tell me that before I left work to drop off my car? Second, what about that Lyft option? The employee told me that his manager wouldn't let him do that because it was further for the Lyft to drive than for them to do it themselves. Um, what? I explain to the employee that I have taken off of work to do this and that they are wasting my time. Still nothing. I ask him to inform his manager of my displeasure. I immediately call my insurance company to get them to cancel this reservation and make me a new one at Enterprise. Enterprise picked me up 15 minutes after that. Do not use this Hertz. Pure garbage customer service.

name: GINA KING
text: Great cars great service very helpful kind .

resp.text: GINA,  thank you for taking the time to write such a great review for us at Hertz Car Rental! We're delighted you had a great experience with our staff and hope to serve you again soon! -Emily

name: Bill Deville
text: very poor customer service! I have never dealt with a woman so rude. we had to drop a car off on a Sunday, a day early mind you. they have no drop box, so I left keys in mailbox at front door. called first thing Monday morning to let them know and the women went off. she said they didnt have to have a dropbox. yall are a car rental business right? people have to drop cars off at odd times right? if I'd kept the car until Tuesday you'd billed me for an extra day right? could I have said you didnt have a dropbox, so I kept it free of charge? I had no other option. I mean I was using my insurance if the car came up stolen it would have been on me too I guess right? this is not the same Hertz that it used to be, it is corporate owned now. different group of people running it. be prepared for a credit check,big deposit, and a long wait, and major attitude. do yourself a favor miss your turn and go an extra half mile down the road to enterprise, they are right down the street. this lady needs to take customer care classes. anyone in there right mind would have said thank you for the heads up on the keys, sorry we do not have a dropbox at this time, sorry for any inconvenience. thank you for choosing Hertz. get a grip on yourself lady and yes I did call corporate. I hope you find baby jesus and get some act right in your system.

name: Amber Nickelson
text: Was thinking about renting a vehicle while my truck was being fixed, I went to the Decatur, AL location.. The employees there were really nice, but overall I'm not satisfied with Hertz at all.. I brought my check stubs as a 2nd form of I.D. the employee said I don't need to see it, Hertz isn't like Enterprise we aren't nosey.. we don't care how much you make.. but you make your customers go through a credit check.. I'd rather you see my check stubs rather than do a credit check.. that's more nosey (in my opinion), also because someone has good credit doesn't mean they are going to take better care of the vehicle rather than someone with less than perfect credit.. customer service was good, very nice people.. but Hertz policies are ridiculous..

text: The staff isn’t friendly also they are a rip off...my rental agreement price and the price when I turned vehicle in changed from 19.24 to 37$.... I don’t recommend doing any type of business with this company...

name: Brian Butler
text: Terrible car I reserved wasn't there had to wait 2 hours to find another one

name: John Samuel Gurtler
text: Terrible business. I made a reservation online and planned to pay at check-out. Before booking I called and asked how much the deposit would be--$200. This amount plus the rental price were on my card and ready to be used. I walked, oh, 7 miles or so in the Alabama heat of the noonday glare to Budget, ready to pick up my rental. The attendant ran my card and I was denied service. I was already exhausted, sweat soaked, blisters on my feet and didn't want to pay out the spleen for an Uber, so I tried hitchhiking back home. Then the local pigs scooped me up and took me to jail. True story.

name: Jay Jay
text: I prepaid for a rental ahead of time on the website, called the day before to confirm that everything was good to go, had someone drive me 3 hours to pick my PREPAID and CONFIRMED rental up only to be told when I arrived there were no cars available and prepaying online is just a “request”. Ummm, they didn’t REQUEST for me to pay, they took that money out of my account IMMEDIATELY and I should have been able to arrive and pick my car up JUST as easily. Waited in their lobby area for hours trying to figure out what I was going to do seeing as to how I was 3 hours from home. Finally a car hauler arrives with cars on it. Long story short- clerk tried to charge an additional $400 on top of the $269 I’d prepaid for a one day rental, I have set strict safety measures on my credit card for my financial protection therefor the credit card company immediately denied the purchase and contacted me. I ensured the card company that it was a legitimate charge by me so they set to approve the transaction and then the clerk at Budget informed me that she couldn’t run my card again for 24 hours due to Budget’s policies. Used my debit card to rent the car, was so informed there would be a $319 charge and $150 would be returned after I returned the car. Car was returned on time, clean, and full of gas- it was checked in in perfect condition. In the 4 days after the original rental date I had OVER $3,000 in fees of different amounts STOLEN from my account from Budget. After fighting with them and contacting the Better Business Bureau for over a week, Budget FINALLY returned everything except $497 to my account. This didn’t make things right, the normal everyday use of my card has caused NUMEROUS overdraft fees that I now have to cover because BUDGET STOLE FROM ME. Y’all PLEASE don’t rent from this place, a one day rental can seriously financially RUIN you, it did me.

name: Reyna Mota
text: Made reservations a month ago. Get to the pick up and am told they need to see my credit card. I let them know that I payed in full for the reservation online with my debit card. She tells me we don't do debit cards only credit. It brakes my heart in two as I am to drive home and see family and know have to find a van for my family of 7. I will never do business with this company as they are also charging me 150 because I had to cancel as they could not help me. If you do not have a credit card do not pick this location or company it will be a waist of time.

text: Was in and out no hassle..

text: Booked a car but didn't get one because there was none available...didn't even try to support us and left us alone calling the service hotline. They also gave us the wrong service number... We arrived 10 minutes before the shop closes, so they just closed the shop left us outside and drove home. Very very bad service! We had to take an Uber back home for 30$. Thanks for nothing!

text: One of the most racist staff. Service is totally not good. Better to avoid this place.

text: The car was up today clean easy to drive and customer service was fantastic

name: Kathy Peacock
text: I have been a long time Enterprise customer until recently, they are on my top list of worst companies, I used to always use them because they are only 500 feet from my office so close and easy to get to when you are on a time frame, but after a bad experience more than once, I branched out and tried Hertz. Hertz is not local to me it is a little bit of a drive, but we got there to pick up our rental and was immediately welcomed in like we were long time customers.  They made the rental process so easy.  They even let me pick the color car I wanted to take since they had a few in the class I was renting, I know that don't seem that special but to me that was above and beyond.  Also upon returning the car the same experience they were so nice, and we felt like we had been renting from them forever!  They have for sure earned our business!  I wish we had one closer to us, but in order to have the best service we will gladly drive the distance!

name: William Sanders
text: Would not recommend this particular location, the service was scarce and the guy was not attentive to our needs. Couldn’t explain well as to what we would’ve needed to do to rent the vehicle I will not be back to the Dothan location.

name: Audrey Lindsey
text: Great service there people are kind and sweet also understanding

name: Matt Cook
text:
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!USE HERTZ IN DOTHAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Rented once and attempted to rent once from the Enterprise Rental Car-Dothan location on Montgomery Highway.  Both times waited over an hour and a half.  This past time, Tuesday June 30th, I had a truck reserved at 8:00 per the app.  When I arrived there were 3 customers waiting outside.  Several employees,  I'd say 4-5 were sitting inside a cubicle talking while 1 person was washing cars. Apparently they don't clean any vehicle until the customer is there waiting.  They would casually check people in as they come up.  An hour later, I was still waiting with about 20 other people.  A gentleman questioned them about this, and they told him it was always an hour minimum wait for a vehicle there.  He took pictures of the one person washing.  They did not like this and asked him not to, then 3 started washing.  I inquired several times about the remaining wait time, and was told each time I was next up.  I clearly was not because I reserved a truck and could see no trucks being cleaned.  Even though the Hertz app showed no trucks, I called Hertz (AT 9:45) in desperation due a meeting I had several hours away.  The nice lady had 1 truck just returned and said she could have it ready once she sent it to the airport Hertz to be detailed.  I explained my frustration with Enterprise, and she told me to come on and get it.  She went out and cleaned it herself and had it ready when I made the 10-15 minute drive to Hertz.  I was in and out within 10 minutes of arriving.  I would pay double and go with Hertz vs. Enterprise now.  Thanks Hertz for the great customer service.

resp.text: Wow, thank you for five-stars, Matt! We're delighted you had a great experience and hope to see you in another Hertz rental soon! -Alexandra

text: As much as I would like to leave more stars for the quick and efficient buying of a truck from Kip, I have to say that TNT sold us a lemon. The truck we bought in November has something wrong with it every week which means my husband is throwing money at parts instead of trying to make the payment. They sold us an expensive extended warranty that we knew nothing about and when the air conditioner went out in the truck, we were told the warranty covers powertrain ONLY. Save time and money and shop elsewhere, There are plenty more reputable dealers around that won't sell you a piece of junk.

name: Clint Chance
text: They welcomed us in with open arms, were more than accommodating. Staff was friendly, however pre-occupied. We bought our vehicle in September. The owner was willing to pay for faulty sensors on the vehicle found at time of purchase. The only major complaint that I have is to Make sure that they complete ALL the paperwork before you leave to help you avoid frequent subsequent trips to sign your name.

name: Kylee Hovel
text: Absolutely the best in the business!!! We got an excellent deal on our Acadia.  It's fully loaded, excellent condition and we couldn't be happier.  Highly recommended!!

name: Michael Goins
text: I went to 2 of Mobile's highest rated car detailers with my car due to me having sap dried on my paint.  WIth no luck at either of these places I contacted TNT and took the car in and in no time my car was back to looking brand new again!!  I refer this place to anyone now who is looking for someone to detail their vehicle..  Staff could not have been nicer and accommodating!!

name: Daniel Woods
text: The worse car lot ever they payments is very expensive they cars are not worth it. They screwed me an my family over on a truck that we had purchased they signed an agreement saying that they was gone fix it in they didnt. Than they told me not to worry about the payments an to use the money to fix it cause they couldn't find the problem. So I found the problem but it was to expensive for me so I told them yesterday that I would catch the payments up today an let them fix it. Why confirm my reservation at 7 just to be told by the guy working at the Hertz counter right next to it that the worker left at 7? name: The Best One Ever
text:
Everything started off great, they had a wonderful SUV available and I was happy to pay the more expensive price just to be on my way after Enterprise in Dothan stood me up for my reservation.
We had a good trip, no hitches. The problems came when it was time to pay. I owed $400 something but saw charges on my credit card for over $800. I called corporate and they told me some $200 in fees were just pre-approvals and would not actually be charged. The other extra fees were $195.81. The local person had no idea what they were for and told me to call back two days later to speak to the manager. I wasn't going to wait, I called corporate.
They charged us an extra hour saying we were late bringing the car back, and then $95 was because they supposedly had to clean out excessive dog hair. I told them that we were not late, and yes we have small dogs as pets, but they didn't go in the car at all, so there's no way there was "excessive dog hair" and we returned it clean. There were no spills, trash, crumbs, or finger prints. Corporate spoke to the local branch and agreed that we did nothing wrong and removed the charges.
THE NEXT DAY I see a new charge for $195.81 (the exact same amount to the penny). I emailed the person at corporate I'd been speaking with and they told me that the local branch said it was now a charge for fuel, that I didn't put gas in the car. Well I did... all throughout the trip and then right before I turned it in, I topped it off at the Murphy USA at Walmart by the airport. I provided a picture of my receipt and haven't heard back yet. The charges still stand on my credit card. How did you fit almost $200 in gas in the car? What is the next fraudulent charge you will come up with? I wonder how much money you've stolen from people who just didn't question you? It really is a shame that you chose to play with my credit card, this review would have been so different.

resp.text: Hello! We're so sorry to hear about the extra charges you were assessed. Please reach out to us at socialinfo@avis.com with the details of your experience and your rental agreement/reservation number, so we can look in to this for you. Also, please refer to your SM post # 221510 on all correspondence. ~Susan

text: Amazing customer service!  Our flight wasn't scheduled to arrive at Dothan airport until 7:55 PM... and this Avis location closes at 8:00 PM.  The Avis representative reassured me the day before she had our flight information and would wait for us past their 8:00 PM closing time if our flight was delayed.  When we arrived just after 8:00 she greeted us by name and had us out the door in minutes.  AWESOME "above and beyond" customer service.  True Southern hospitality at its best!

name: Parker Gillespie
text:
If it were possible to give less than one star I would.

Checking in was smooth and friendly, clearly a different person than the person that was at checkout. When returning the Avis rental we were 4 minutes past the 24hr period for the one day rental charge and therefore charged an additional day. After unsuccessful attempts to reason with the agent(Sherry) who was unwilling to apply logic and unwilling to compromise on charging us for the additional day. I was then told that not only was I being charged for two full days, but I couldn't keep the car any longer because she had closed the contract (as she made the final key strokes to close it).

In an attempt to avoid the additional day charges we had previously decided to skip lunch in an effort to get the car returned, but now with over 4 hrs to kill before our flight and nothing open at the Dothan airport I decided (since we had now paid for two days)we should keep the car for a few more hours to go into town to get lunch. This is where things get really irrational, not only we were informed that we couldn’t use the car, but that I had to give her the keys or she would report the car stolen. Our flight that was 4 hrs in the future was the next flight out of the entire airport, there was not only nobody in line at Avis, but nobody else in sight in the airport. There was clearly no demand for this vehicle for the time I am talking about.

I called Avis 800 customer service by phone and was told that this should not be a issue and that “yes, of course you can keep the car, you paid for it”. According to Sherry, she doesn’t have to answer to Avis because her “Daddy” owns the franchise and demanded the keys. She really said that.

So I’m saying that this is beyond poor customer service and bad business...Avis should be ashamed to have their name on her shirt.

Sherry and Tina (and the person who cleans and checks the rentals after they have been returned) went out of their way to help recover what my better half left in the rental. They never lost patience with us, they were very understanding. If We are ever back to Dothan, We will definitely use Avis again. Thank you Avis for employing such stellar and outstanding employees! They are truly an asset. Thank you for going the extra mile!!!

name: Heath Parker
text: My wife rented a car thanksgiving weekend, Chevy Malibu. She returned it with a full tank and the guy asked if she was going to fill it up. She said she already did.She put gas in it until the pump clicked, had the receipt and gauge on full. He said it would hold more and asked again if she was going to fill it up. She said she did. He charged us for 2 gal. at 7 or 8 dollars a gallon. Keep in mind my truck will not get 2 gal  extra after the pump clicks. He also just guessed at the 2 gal., not actually filling it up and seeing. The car would puke gas if filled to the brink. Experience from the trip. So if you rent a car make sure gas is poring out when you bring it back. Plus the car was given to us saying the oil needed to be changed and them knowing we was going on a long trip. We put 2000 miles on it.

resp.text: Heath Parker, we sincerely apologize for the negative experience you had while renting with us. Please contact our customer service at 1.800.352.7900 to discuss further.

name: Sean Miller
text:
Would give them 0 stars if it were an option. I bought a used transmission from them, installed it and less than a week later the transmission is slipping heavily. No problem, returned the old one for a "new" one from them. Installed it and only made it around the block before it started slipping again. Frustrated I contact them for the third time about getting a WORKING transmission just to have them claim that something is wrong with the "installer or computer in the car".
Just to note, both transmissions were sent to me with broken clutch lock up solenoids, shift control solenoids, as well as dirt in axle bearings behind the seals, muck behind all the solenoids as well. On the first trans he sent me I had to swap over everything, assuming he would send me another trans complete with everything the second go round I didn't bother taking all the solenoids off. When I received the new one, of course all the solenoids were broken. So after having to go source and replace all the solenoids I kept them after having to return the last transmission. Today I went into his car yard and actually found all my undamaged sensors in his junk transmission. He wouldn't let me have another transmission until I gave him his sensors out of the older one. He then claimed that he had only sold me one transmision. And that he didn't have another transmission anymore.
Awful business, 0 stars

text:

When I picked up the car on Saturday,  the man made rude distasteful comments about people in general using electric bikes as we talked about it.

Distasteful, rude, unreliable and lacking in the area of customer care.

I will never spend another dollar with U Save.

text: If I could give 0 stars I would! I have rented from this company 15+  times over six years but today I have had the worst customer service experience of my life! The only reason I was a return customer here is because of the one nice employee that was always there. The two idiots working there now laughed as they told me he no longer worked there. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else! You are getting what your paying for. Which is old cars and two of the nastiest people I’ve encountered in customer service. You’d think they’d be more particular of how they would treat a customer who has rented from the Alex City, Valley, and Auburn locations many times but they are too unprofessional and rude to see that $80 isn’t worth losing a frequent faithful renter.

name: Kaitlin DeWitt
text: I would recommend against renting a Hertz vehicle at the Mobile Airport. I booked my reservation pick up for noon, and I tried to pick up my vehicle around approximately 7:00 PM. I was told the vehicle was not ready, and that at least five more customers were in line ahead of me before my vehicle would be ready. At this location, the service desks for Hertz, Thrifty, and Dollar are combined - I had a very similar experience three months ago at Thrifty at the Mobile Airport. During this occasion, I set my rental car pick up for 6:00 PM and did not have a vehicle until 11:12 PM. This experience influenced me to set my pick up time for noon today and not pick it up until later, just in the chance that this happened again. It unfortunately did not help. The desk representative was pleasant to speak with, but I will no longer rent from this location.

resp.text: Kaitlin, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We hate to hear that you're disappointed with us. We'd like to make this right , please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam

resp.text: Chelsea, thank you so much for the review! I'm happy to see that you had a pleasant experience renting with us at Hertz Car Rental. We hope to serve you again in the future! #HertzTeam ~Nikeya

name: Michael Deas
text:
Normally service at MOB has been friendly and dependable. This time, however, on Wed 24 Oct, I was given a car smaller than I reserved, which was not acceptable for this trip (carrying passengers). When I asked for a replacement, I was given a vehicle with 47,000 miles on it that apparently had not been thoroughly checked. By that evening, the key fob was acting up. By the next morning, the battery was dead. After reporting to Hertz, I had to unload the car in the rain, catch a ride with a friend, and continue my meetings, then catch a Lyft to the airport. Hertz sent for a tow truck to get the car, which was picked up at 9:48 on Thu 25 Oct. Yet Hertz charged me for two extra days that I did not use, and then to add insult to injury, also added a late fee. All this after having been on the phone with Hertz 5 times that morning to get their car taken care of. I explained all this to the agents at MOB; they gave me the number of their manager, whom I called and left a voicemail for. I received no call back. When I called the corporate office about the bill, I was told I would get a $20 discount on the bill--even though they charged me for two extra days that I didn't even have the car.
After 22 years of being a customer, I mistakenly thought I would be treated better than this.

name: JaTori Thomas
text: The worst! I have literally been calling Hertz since for the past hour to speak to one of the two females at the desk. I’ve made 15+ calls. A few of them were picked up and hung up. I also reached out to the 1-800 line, the nice representative attempted to call the Airport location 3 times as well. Not to mention, I had to wait an hour and half after my scheduled reservation just to get a vehicle for them to give my vehicle away. This is awful customer service. You all should think about hiring more associates if you are short staffed or hiring people who actually want to make your reputable business remain at the top of quality service.

text: poor car management, poor service, uncaring. 73 yr old mother had to wait over 4hrs to get her car she reserved. this forced her to get a hotel and pick the car up on the morning.  no restitution or apology. only after complaining to corporate, online and to Expedia(booked with them) did they offer no charge for the gas.  They should have offered a reasonable amount for a hotel and have the car in the morning.  this would have helped her specific reservation about not driving at night and alleviated their car shortage problem.

name: Joe
text: I will never use Hertz at this airport again. I got off my flight early and went to get my rental car. I was notified they didnthave one ready that I had to wait for my pickup time. Not a big deal, waited the twenty minutes. Then I asked again and they told me they still didnt have a car for me. That I should again have a seat and wait. They wouldnt let me know how long a car would take or the status of a car. All they would say is they have luxury cars avaliable if I wanted to upgrade. It took them a half an hour past my pick up time. I called hertz customer service durring this time and they basically said this is a small shop and they overbook the cars and sometimes you have to wait until another person returns a car before one is ready even if you have a reservation. Once I finally got a car it was filthy inside and windshield was gross. It was wet on the outside like they sprayed it with a hose but they didnt clean it. I rent from hertz all over the country and will say this was my worst experience. There customer service was atrocious.

After another rental car company at Mobile Airport failed me with their attitude and service I turned to Hertz!
It was my vacation and also my birthday week! I was looking forward to this vacation and it was almost runined. The nicest people at the Hertz counter on 3 different encounters , same trip, and  different people all spot on! Outstanding service. The moved the obstacle from blocking my vacation!!!
Excited!!

text: My rental car was ready when I get there. I didn't have to wait long in line. The was clean and didn't smell like cigarette smoke.

name: Mark Crable
text:
I arrived into Mobile Regional Airport quite late due to a missed connection in Charlotte, NC. (Flight leaving CVG was 1 hour late departing.)

Hertz had eliminated my reservation for a rental car and only had a small Hyundi and a mini-van left. I elected the Hyundi. It's brakes were a bit grabby and the driver's side carpet behind the gas pedal was worn and torn. Otherwise . . . it was okay.

The rental agent told me that my credit card on file had been declined. So I used a debit card for the rental. Later I discovered that Hertz had tried to hold $350+ on my credit card twice . . . thus maxing it out. (I am between jobs and was in Alabama for an interview.)

Other than that, the rental car and process was fine. When I got to my hotel in Jackson, AL, I discovered that the travel agency had reserved a room for me in Jackson, MS. So, I slept in the rental car at the parking lot of the McDonald's in Jackson, AL. The rental was okay for sleeping with a driver's seat that reclined nicely. But, at that point, I'd wished I'd rented the mini-van.

Great trip!

Oh, and the interview went well as did the trip home to Cincinnati.
- Mark

resp.text: Hi Tiffany.  Thank you for the feedback.  We use Square as our credit card processing company.  Square refunds the money to your financial institution within 2-7 business days.   Your financial institution could also take 2-7 business days to accept the refund as well.  I will look into your specific transaction if you can tell me what name the rental was in and which of our locations you rented from.  Thanks!

name: Carl Fejedelem
text: We have used Citywide twice in the past year.   Rates are good, vehicles clean and well maintained, and the service is top notch.  This local car rental company is so much easier to use than one of the nationwide franchises.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback and your business.  You both are a pleasure to do to business with and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.

text: They are very friendly and curtious. They are very quick and do their jobs in a professional manner. I would recommend them to anyone and everyone that needs to rent a vehicle. Great job guys keep up the great work.

Ok...... WOW!!! This experience with this company was absolutely fantastic. Russell Barker made this experience from start to finish. I travel for work and I rent on a regular basis from enterprise, hertz, and budget and none of those places make you feel like you matter like Russell at City Wide. I will call Russell any and every time I need a vehicle from
now on. The cars are super clean, gas tanks full, and flexibility of things come up are all there through Russell. I love that I can support a locally owned place like this. I thank them and can’t wait to call upon them again.

name: Stephanie Patterson
text: If i can give negative stars i would in a heart beat. I made my reservation months ago, now i fly across the united states to find out my daughter and i are stranded along with dozens of others because you over booked? This is horrendous customer service and completely unacceptable. I can sit here for 6 hours till you close in hopes of getting a car, but chances are slim. Great way to start a vacation!

name: prasam patel
text:
I don't recommend this car rental. First when i went in to pick up my car they didn't have the car that i booked so they ended up giving another car. I paid for total 3 days in the car. It picked up my car on 11/16/20 at 8:30 am and dropped my car on 11/18/20 at 3:30 pm. When i return my car my total was suppose to be $247.50 but they charged me $502.98. Which is double the money. I picked this car rental because they showed me cheap options but after using it they almost doubled the money.
I called them twice to ask that what was the problem with charging me double? They said they are absolutely sorry and they will refund my money in 12 day on my car.
16 days late i never get a call from them and when i call them they reply that they cant issue refund cause my car came in late. I clearly told them that i didn't pay for 2 days i have paid for 3 days but they never listened. Even in the receipt it clearly says that they are gonna charge me for 3 days but they ended up charging me double.

All i wanna say is that this car rental is a BIG scam. They show you cheaper price but they get you after you use their car.

name: Nicole Bentley
text:
Pickup at this location is TERRIBLE. The signs pointing to the kiosk point the wrong direction. When you finally find it (on the 3rd row rather than the first) they tell you to go to the kiosk next to the elevator. Where you ACTUALLY need to go is inside an unmarked grey building.
The Thrifty kiosk inside is closed, so you have to go to yet another kiosk. They have ONE person working to cover multiple car rental companies, and despite claiming their cars are located on site, you have to sit and wait because they are actually stored elsewhere and they have to be cleaned. They don’t begin cleaning them until you check in at the counter. There are ZERO cars that are actually ready. The wait time to get your car after you check in at the counter is over an hour.
Pay more and pick up somewhere that isn’t at the airport.

name: Randy Larkins
text:
I rented a car that was supposed to be returned on Saturday 10/3 at 3:40 p.m. I returned it at the Thrifty Rental at around 1:00 p.m. on 10/3 and flew home to Colorado.  Then, on Monday, I started receiving calls that the car wasn't returned. I called the number specified, only to be told that they would check into it and would send me an email within 48 hours.  Instead, all I received was an automated message each day stating that the car wasn't returned. I called again on 10/9 and spoke to Kathy, who told me that she would check into it. The next day I received another automated call.  I have never heard from Thrifty at all except for these automated calls.  It seems like, in a day of GPS on all rental cars, the car could be found and seen that it was obviously NOT in Colorado, where I live.  Instead of checking that, $60 was taken from my account each day until I was forced to cancel my card.  Thrifty owes me an apology, and at least $500 that was taken without my consent after the car was returned.  I have threatened legal action, and will not stop until an acknowledgment is made that I do not have the car anymore.  I will not rent from Thrifty again, and I will make sure that all of my friends and family know of my predicament with your company.

I called Thrifty at Raleigh-Durham to try to settle the matter, and was hung up on 3 times after selecting different options to try to get through to a person. Extremely unprofessional!

name: Sandra Johansen
text:
Huge thank you to the dignified female desk agent working late Thursday night, Jan 9, 2020 at Birmingham International airport who turned a series of day-long plane delays and changes into a reassuring experience of kindness.  That lady proved to be an angel.
Thank you!

resp.text: Sandra, thank you for your positive review, it’s our goal is to always provide our customers with an all-around stellar experience.  If you haven't already, please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger at: m.me/thriftycarrental.  Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. -##ThriftyTeam ~Nikeya

name: Mentral Ledbetter
text:
0 stars!

The overall experience with Thrifty was TERRIBLE from the reservation to the customer service, it’s all TERRIBLE!!! I was provided with the totaled reservation amount, all to receive a completely different actual counter amount.   I WILL NEVER USE THRIFTY AGAIN!

I hardly ever do any reviews but I felt a need to share this and have others aware!

resp.text: Mentral, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review at Thrifty Car Rental. Please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger at: m.me/thriftycarrental. Our social customer care team would love to review and hear about your experience with us. ~Nikeya

name: Jesse Sauceda
text: Called 2 times with no answer just keep ringing....Sad.

name: Jessica A
text: NEVER RENT FROM THIS PLACE!!!! You get what you pay for!! Pay the extra money and go with a more reputable company. I got a flat tire out of town from where I rented the car so I could not use the spare to get back since it was a long drive. The company made me pay to fix their tire!!!! I will never rent here again!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review at Thrifty Car Rental. Could you do me a favor and reach out to us on Facebook Messenger at: m.me/thriftycarrental? Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. - Justin

name: Samantha Nelson
text:
Both my pickup and my drop off experiences left a bad taste in my mouth. At pick up, not once, but twice did the employees give away the car they were planning to give me. I’m not sure what the other was but there were around 5 of us waiting for close to an hour before we were able to leave with vehicles. From what I gathered from those around me, everyone had pre-booked a car. So it’s not like our arrival was a surprise and they were having to rearrange. When I was called up to the counter to be sent out to the outside counter to get keys, the employee was way more excited to talk to her friends than to help me. Then I got outside to pick up the keys and they go wandering off to find it. Only to come back and tell me that they were getting a car pulled around for me as they had given it away. The employee tried to frame it as a positive thing as she had gotten me ‘upgraded.’ At this point, I was more than frustrated and just wanted to get out of the airport. I had hoped returning the car would be a better experience. Boy, was I mistaken.
Upon returning the car to the airport, the signage is terrible. So I ended up in the wrong space. Like the return signs pointed at a chain link fence for the direction you should go to return the car. I finally found it. But no one was there. So I parked the car and went to go inside. I got sent to a few different people before someone was like ‘no, you have to move the car here. We can’t accept it over there.’ I offered her the keys again and she told me that she couldn’t accept them, even though I told her the car was by their signs and in the parking lot and this was a signage issue. This was the same employee who told me she had gotten me an ‘upgrade.’ Another one of the employees realized I was frustrated and goes ‘come with me. I’ll go get it.’ So we walk off to the car. Well, turns out, I’m not the only one that had this problem. They were able to leave the car behind and get on to their flight. I went to give her the keys and she goes ‘no, I need you to follow me and I’ll show you how to take it back.’ She gets in the other car and leads me out of the parking deck, but not before she almost backs that car up onto the car I was driving. She leads me back in to the “proper spot” that is labeled hertz and in tiny letters underneath it has dollar and thrifty, while their big signs point off into the distance about returns. Once we get back to where they want the car, she doesn’t get out. Just sits in the car and waits for someone else to walk up. She rolled her window down. And I asked if I should just leave the car on. And she mumbles something about someone else coming to check me out and give me a receipt. The employee who told me I would have to move the car shows up and checks me out.
I would much rather pay any of the other car rental companies in the airport twice what I paid for the car as my experience was terrible. I will never use this company for a car rental and will encourage my friends and family to do the same.

name: bigmomma king
text: When I brought my car back to the airport on the 26th of December, the young lady with the beautiful black horned rimmed glasses was so friendly and professional! She definitely needs to be in management training. I didn't get her name but her attitude spoke volumes! Alabama is my home and I am here from California! I got great help in Atlanta also! The car was expensive in Atlanta!

name: mary jackson
text: I've had nothing but great experiences with them. It's so easy to rent from them. They don't take you through the hassle like all of the other rental places.

name: Christopher Spencer
text: These people are fantastic.  They get me in and out every time with quickness and its hassle free. I highly recommend anyone to do business with Thrifty Car Rental at the Birmingham , AL Airport

text: None available in garage upon returning my car. So I left the keys in the box like the sign said to do. Now I've been hit with a bill double what I was told upon renting the car all because you don't staff available to check in cars when they were dropped off.

name: TYRONE
text: I have been waiting a hour to get my car. Its pretty frustrating listening to people who have come after me get upgrades. Never again will I spend a dime here.

text: Jerica, was absolutely the best customer service agent that we have ever experienced..thx so much

text: Have had many rentals thru Birmingham Airport location over past 3 years because they usually have the best rental prices even though it wasn't always a pleasant experience. Over the last 6 months Theifty seems to have overhauled both their car rentals and employees here. Now their cars are so much cleaner and newer models. Their employees are now friendly and helpful. Such a better experience now. Much easier and quicker to get checked in and out than it used to be.

name: Ashley Gibson
text:
I'M TRYING TO SAVE YOUR TIME AND MONEY! PLEASE READ BEFORE RENTING FROM HERE!

I don't even know where to start after 5 phone call attempts to resolve a $535 overcharge on my credit card. I rented a car for 2 days but was charged for 13 days. Since their customer service has refused to help me,  I started looking through my paperwork thoroughly and immediately found the incompetency. I checked my vehicle in  with Aerial but my receipt shows a different customer and different license number.

Now, I pointed this out to their customer service/billing department and you would think they would be able to resolve it, right? Yea, okay. The rep hung up in my face after I said I would not get off the phone until I speak to someone who can resolve the issue. Great customer service (sarcasm)!

Well after making my 5th phone call, I was told I'd have to make another phone call related to the same issue and have to repeat the problem over again. You would think they would have common courtesy to forward the issue to the appropriate department or person, but noooo the customer has to make repetitive phone calls without an outcome in sight.

name: Gerald Morrison
text: Good vehicle, bad brakes. I think they are warped.  I told the rental return guy.

text: Rental car was perfect, no problem there. On the other hand, my handicap tag, holder and car insurance card was discarded, taken or whatever, was not returned to me as of this date. Please! Whoever clean the car that I rented, find and return the items to me. Thank you much.

name: Hannah Barnes
text: DO NOT use these people. They are scam artists and will take your money. I was not able to get my car and they refused to give me a refund when I didn’t even come and get the car!! The woman and man that were there for rude and so unhelpful and the people over the phone were no better. DO NOT use these people they will take your money

name: Brittany Perrine
text: Travel tip, don't use Thrifty. Had a blow out saturday night, no spare, they have yet to get the car or bring me another, today is Monday!!!! The car is stuck in a parking lot. Left stranded. They have their money, why do they care? Paid in advance for 3 weeks and have been able to use the car 2 days. HORRIBLE. None of the reps I have talked to speak good english. All they do is push me from person to person. Customer service will not give me a number to the local office, claims they do not have it. They want ME to pay for a tow truck?? WHAT? Shouldn't have crappy tires on cars you rent. You should have sent someone out Saturday night with a car for me and to take this one back. How do you not have a spare tire in a rental? Beyond frustrated. You best believe I better be getting a refund for all these days I am stranded. Once they said they would send a tow truck to get the car, but I would have to come in for another car. Seriously? NO CAR, how can a customer come there, wouldn't be renting one if they had one.

name: Monique Williams
text: Easy, hassle free rental experience...the reservation process is simple to use..overall perfect experience!

name: Kenneth Nix
text: **BEWARE** Super shady business!! On 11/11/20, I made a reservation to pick up on 11/12/20. When I got to this location on pickup day there was a sign on the door that said “we are sorry for any inconvenience, but we had to close today. Please call customer service.”  Customer service escalated my call, and told me I could rent from a competitor and they would reimburse the difference. So I did, and now they will not reimburse me because I had an SUV reserved with them and rented the only thing available from a competitor, a Ford Taurus (A CHEAPER VEHICLE). It was their way of getting out of paying me!!  So now I lost my prepayment with them $100 and had to pay the bill from the competitor $300. So good luck renting from these guys. **It is a gambling game and the house always wins**

name: Queen Pen
text: My husband and I were in a wreck and since we were from out of town, Enterprise wouldn't take our debit cards. After a walk down the highway we came across Avis. The young man named BJ in there immediately eased our fears of not being able to get home to our children. He had us in and out of there in less than 10 minutes, the car was clean and the service was EXCELLENT!!!!!! I would HIGHLY recommend that anyone that lives locally in need of a car rental to go to Avis, I'll forever be thankful to that young man for getting me home.

name: Casey M
text: We had a confirmed reservation but upon arriving they were closed, with no notice, not answering the phones and did not contact us that they were unable to honor our reservation. We had to scramble for a vehicle at Enterprise to be able to make our planned trip. Huge inconvenience and unprofessional business ethics.

The day of the rental was an unfortunate delay beyond his control but he graciously made concessions and assisted better that I even would have expected.  I will definitely return and give my support to this individual.  It was worth the drive from Gadsden

DO NOT book a rental from this place!!! This location is closed and they didn’t tell us! Even after being told this I received confirmation to pick up the vehicle. We called Customer service again and they assured us it was open. Now I need a car and it’s gonna take 7-10 business days to get my money back! These people are a joke!!!!
Not to mention we drove an hour to the location for nothing!!!!

text: This place....this company that claims to be a car rental company is far from professional. Book a car, confirm reservation, call again day before, confirm reservation. Ah you can only guess to my surprise that they left a note on the door stating, "there are no rental cars at this location." Call the number on the door they hung that directed you to Budget, who can't see Avis customers, call Avis to be told after 25 minutes that, in a nutshell "sucks to be you." This hack business is the worst rental car service in the industry.

text:
No one is in the office and you have
to call a manager to get your rental. Customer service is about zero.  It looks like a deserted area with grass grown up and cars with flats. The car wasn't ready and reservation was made the day before.

name: Liam Dacey
text: Avoid this place at all costs. Earlier today, I rented a car for a Noon pickup. I was running 5 minutes late to pick up my car, and realized that I would be arriving at 12:05 (5 minutes after they were closing, because it was Saturday). I called the store and spoke with one employee and his manager to let them know. The manager said that he would wait until 12:05 for me, but he "had somewhere to be" and wouldn't be able to wait any longer. When I arrived at 12:05, as promised, the office was closed and both the manager AND his employee were gone. This has left me carless and stranded here for the weekend. I'd highly recommend going down the street to Enterprise. Sadly, they didn't have any cars left for me today when I checked with them, but they were super friendly and informed me that they always wait for their customers to pick up their cars on Saturdays, even after they close.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize, Liam Dacey. Please call us at 1.800.352.7900 to discuss this further so we can provide you with assistance.

When I returned the car and told David what they said, He started cursing and said that He could not do that. I called Avis and had them to speak directly with him, he was very angry at this point, but I was able to get another vehicle. I will never rent another vehicle from  him. Very bad customer service.

Because they had our reservation at 12 those around had already closed so we missed out on getting a rental to top it off. Avis you don't deserve a Thanks, but Thanks for your crappy service.
