name: Kathryn Gossett
text:
I really wouldn't even rate them one star, but I had to click at least one for it to let me leave a review. They asked for the review, so I am complying, but I'm being honest!

We reserved a FULL size vehicle - a little over a week ahead of time - for a trip we needed to make.

Imagine our surprise when the Assistant Manager, Travis, took us out to a Chrysler 200! (STANDARD SIZE vehicle, which rents for $4/day less than a FULL SIZE car.) We knew the car looked small and we asked him if it was a full size car to which he replied, “Yes, it is.” Back inside the office, we noticed the Chrysler 200 was showing right on the counter top as a STANDARD SIZE car. We asked Travis about it and he stated, “It goes back and forth. It was just moved up to a FULL SIZE car when the new ones came out.” Okay, we didn’t question him further. Then, we went out to get in the vehicle and see if it would be comfortable enough for our trip. When my husband got in the car, he immediately popped back out and said it wreaked of cigarette smoke! I said, “I can’t ride in that then. I am allergic to cigarette smoke”. My husband knew this and that is why he was letting me know. Travis was going inside to get his helper to spray the car and see if it would help. His helper said he had already sprayed inside it. It was horrible! Travis then asked us, “What can I do to make this okay for you?” We told him we needed a different car and he stated he didn’t have anything else to offer us. We kept talking and we asked him, again, “Is this REALLY considered a FULL SIZE car?” He FINALLY admitted it was a STANDARD SIZE vehicle. He then offered to bring our cost down to the standard size pricing (how nice of him, since that is what we were getting!) and he also said he would do a 10% discount plus take $30 off. We truly had no choice but to accept his offer. I told him I wanted to get it in writing of just how much we were to be refunded, once the car was returned. He told me the total we would be refunded and he put it in writing.

Well, we were hoping we could use some of our Young Living Essential Oils to get rid of the cigarette smell, but it did not work. This car had been smoked in for so long, the smell was already set in! My husband and I were both sick the whole time we were gone due to having to ride in that horrible smell! I can not believe someone can call and make a RESERVATION for a car and NOT get the type car they reserved! What is the point in making a reservation, if you are still just going to have to take whatever they have to offer you? This is NOT good business and I doubt we will ever use Enterprise again! In hindsight, we should have told Travis to get on the phone and call one of their locations to get us a FULL SIZE, SMOKE FREE car to the Brewton office immediately.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Kathryn. If you can provide a few more details, I would be happy to look into this further for you. Please email Care@Enterprise.com with your contact information, your reservation/rental agreement number, and the details of your experience. Please include reference # 160610-002688 in the subject line of your email. Thanks. –Shane

text:
Updating in July of 2019: Let it be known that Bryan Leber and his staff have brought back the quality our Brewton office once had!!! These guys are fantastic! We have rented from them twice so far this year and both experiences have been exceptional. I am so thrilled to be able to update my review. Thank you, Bryan, for bringing pride back to the Brewton office, I have thoroughly enjoyed spreading the news that our Enterprise is back!!!!!!
First, let me say this location was at one time top notch. Those days are gone!!!!!! After making a car reservation a week in advance, I get a call an hour before pickup today that I am the fifth in line to get a vehicle this afternoon. Well, the business day has ended and here I am without our rental and no call returned!!!! This is not the first for this type of occurrence at this store. I believe in second chances but this fourth chance has pushed me too far. Please, if you make a reservation, ask for your reservation number. I wasn't given my number this time and didn't think to ask for it. But, I obviously had a reservation in the system because the store called to let me know it would be ready later than 2:00. However, when I called customer service, they weren't showing I had a reservation!!!! So, my conclusion is that our reservation was canceled by the Brewton office personnel.

I called 3 times during this month of waiting, at different times of the day to make sure I wasn’t calling when they were busy, and they would never answer. I finally went up there and was told that the online rental tool is not a good tool. I do not think they should have the tool as an option if no one will call you back. name: Abbey Otinger
text: I wish there was an option for no stars. Just had the worst car rental experience of my life...anywhere and any car rental brand. We waited over 40 minutes to get our rental...it would be understandable if the place was packed, but there were only two customers ahead of us. The airport was practically empty. We had reserved car seats for our twins and it was an ordeal in itself. One seat’s belt was stuck  and couldn’t be attached until we wrestled with it and the other seat was set up for a really tiny baby. We had to take it off and rearrange the whole thing. So after waiting for the car a long time, we had to spend time fixing the seats before putting our crying kids into them. To make things absolutely worse...the car smells like smoke! We left the airport and had to stop right away for some air freshener. It’s been only twenty minutes in this car, and we cannot wait to return it! It’s going to be a very long four days before we can do that. Oh and of course, nobody went over the car to make sure there isn’t any pre-existing damage. My husband took photos of the damage to show when we return. Absolutely no sense of urgency to help the customers. Couldn’t think of spending another minute at the Alamo service desk on this Thanksgiving Day. 😔

resp.text: Hi Abbey, I would like to know more about your experience so I can help. Please email care@alamo.com and include the rental location, rental agreement or reservation numbers and your contact information. Thank you. - HH

name: Scott S
text:
Alamo has now emailed me twice to provide feedback on my experience (July 18, 2017 3pm)...well, I'll let them know. However, they might not be happy. Initial reservation was fine, actually getting the car and returning the car I experienced very helpful people. But the woman at the counter that checked me in...that's another story. Immediately upon walking up, I could sense that I was taking the representative away from something else she would rather be doing, even though there were no other customers. There was nothing friendly about this person. She didn't explain any of what I was initialing and signing. But my favorite part was the end - she told me to go out in the garage and get my car. I turned and pointed outside saying "so right in there?" She said yea and then turned and mumbled under her breath. I began to turn away and realized she had issues with my question. I turned around and asked, "I'm sorry, did you say something?" She said "No" I asked "Are you sure, because it sure sounded like you had something to say". She said "No" again and turned away. I left there thinking, is this what folks are like in Huntsville? No there not, but SHE needs remedial training in customer service. Although, I don't think you can change her attitude with training.

Well, Alamo, you asked and I provided. I would definitely use Alamo again. Just look out for my friend at the reception counter.

text: Quick, easy, efficient and friendly check-in.  Superb service from check-in desk agent, Adrena.  Kudos to this personable and smiling counter representative!

name: John French
text:
This is a good news / bad news review. I arrived on a Saturday night just before the counter was closing. Since I seemed to be the last person in line, I was curious as to whether they would have an intermediate car available (Which I had reserved). They didn't, but they gave me a courtesy upgrade. The two women at the counter (One was a Trainee) were very polite and friendly (I typically rent from Enterprise, Alamo's holding company, and I have always received excellent service so I was happy to see that this transferred over to Alamo). The lady who checked me in indicated that the vehicle was in the garage across the street, and due to the late hour, there was not an Alamo (or National) attendant on duty to check the car out with me. She requested that I preform the usual walk-around to check for obvious damage and to let the counter know if I saw anything. Given that this was a black car in a dark garage with cars parked on both sides and in-front, there's only so much a 50+ year old can see, but I didn't see anything obvious. I left and spent the next three days with my daughter looking at schools in Alabama and Tennessee.

When I returned the car (in broad daylight), the young man checking the car in pointed out to me a scrape on the lower portion of the passenger side bumper. This I had not noticed. He indicated that I would need to go to the counter to have a "damage report" filled out. This made me angry. While I can certainly appreciate that many renters must not take good care of the cars they rent and car company's have a legitimate interest in protecting their property, I am not one of them. I treat other people's property better than I treat my own. I have never received so much as a j-walking ticket in my life. I certainly did not run over any curbs or damage their vehicle (Toyota Avalon, CA Plates, almost 30K miles on it). To make a long story short, after about 40 minutes at the counter or so, the paperwork was completed and I ran for my flight (which I almost missed). I should, in all fairness, again mention that the counter personnel were polite and professional at all times, with the Manager remarking that even she could have missed the scrape at night in the parking garage,

As I travel on business about 25 times per year (renting cars each time), I am very familiar with the "walk-around." This is the first time, however, that I can recall not having an attendant     present during the initial damage check. Given a black, relatively high mileage rental car, in a dark garage (the typical yellow overhead bulbs), there was no way that I would have seen scratches on the lower bumper (or, probably, anywhere else on the car unless they were on the door panel, hood, roof, trunk, etc.). A dink, dent, or crack is usually obvious - scratches not so depending upon the car, scratch position, and lighting conditions. The next morning when I left my hotel in broad daylight, I did notice that the paint had many hairline scratches all over the car - as if someone had driven it down a heavily wooded dirt road where branches had scraped it. In any event, I never put a scratch on the car.

I am waiting to see whether I receive a call from Alamo's Recovery Unit in O.K. I will explain to them exactly what I have just written and add that a customer cannot report what a customer did not see, especially in a dark garage without anyone to walk around with them. It is unconscionable to hold a customer responsible for a scratch or scratches that (1) he/she did not cause and (2) could not have seen or could have been easily missed given the site conditions. I will update my review (along with other reviews) depending upon Alamo's next steps - if any. Again, the service was very friendly, and I understand that they were just "doing their jobs," but that doesn't change the fact that I was delayed 40 minutes, have to expect a call on damage that I did not cause, and am being held responsible for something that I could not see.

resp.text: Hi there, John! Thank you for taking your time to write this review! We would like to discuss this in further detail. Please email Care@Alamo.com with your contact information, reservation or rental agreement number, DX or claim number, and additional details. List "Reference #151028-001445" in the subject line so we are better able to assist you. Thank you. - Lauren

name: Anonymous
text: WORST, absolute worst company ever!!!! Our first time renting a car I flat out asked the guy on the phone if we could have a second driver and how much it'd be, he said it would cost nothing and continued doing with my reservation. Not to mention he didn't honor the price online. Never once said anything about the $200 deposit. I have my email to prove it wasn't in there. We find all this out the DAY OF OUR TRIP!!! I call customer service, go through not 1 rep but 3! All who want to apologize but none who will fix the problem. I work customer service for the past 10 years and have never seen this level of disregard for the trouble I'm being put through. Had I known this was the case I would've been able to shop around.  Let's not also dismiss the fact that while pulling the car around they backed into a fire hydrant and my husband brought to their attention. The first thing asked was did my husband do it. They just handed him the keys!!!! I was refused a phone number for the regional manager as well. The "Escalation" rep states they will get someone to call me back, when asked a timeframe? I was told a couple days. I will NEVER rent a car from this company again. I strongly believe in giving good feedback when deserving and I do not leave bad reviews but his was the worst transaction I've ever had with a company in my life. In my line of work we are required to give up front fees, if not we honor what was quoted. Not tell a customer too bad.

resp.text: We take customer service seriously and want to assist you. Please email care@alamo.com with your contact information, rental information and all the details above so we can address this situation. Thank you- Chris M

name: Whitney Jones
text: I love Alamo and the Alamo team members of HSV!!! Always courteous and knowledgeable. I have never been disappointed when I come to visit Huntsville for a visit! There is no better place to rent a car from than Alamo! I am forever a fan!!!

name: Robert Serio
text: I needed a mini van to take my extended family on a vacation trip this summer.  Could not find a Suburban or Tahoe but Alamo had a 7 passenger mini-van.  The car was brand new and perfect for our trip.  It was ready for pickup at the time we requested and the return was a piece of cake.  I am very pleased with my experience and will definitely use Alamo again in the future.

name: Robert Hamilton
text:
Car was good but customer service wasn't so much.  Getting my car took about 25 minutes, which seemed unusually slow given that here was only one person ahead of me when I arrived at the rental counter.

My biggest issue is with customer service after I returned the car.  I believe that I left my camera in the car and have not been able to reach anyone that would let me know whether or not it was found.  Many times that I called, I simply got a busy signal or no answer.  The two times that I did get through over two weeks, I left detailed messages in their "lost and found" mailbox with the details of my rental and the lost camera.  I never received a return call despite indications that I should hear back within a day or so.

I see from other reviews that I'm not the only customer that's had problems getting through to customer service.  It seems that Alamo doesn't really care about improving the customer experience, despite what it says.

resp.text: We'd like to hear more about your experience, Robert. Please email us at care@NationalCar.com with your contact information, reservation and/or rental agreement numbers, and any other details you would like to add. Please include reference number 160106-003282 in the subject line of your email. Thanks! -Collin

name: Philip Warner
text: Was offered an upgrade that i was to pay for. Told it was a new car. It reeked of cigarette smoke so I returned to the counter to be told that there were no cars of the class I booked available. The agent called for another car. Had to wait about ten minutes. Received an inconvenience discount. Second car was almost new but with a scratch so I had to stop at exit and take the damage ticket to be signed. The rental process in all took about 30 mins. All of the staff were friendly and let down by their processes. Frustrating.

resp.text: Mr. Warner, we would like to look into this further. Please email care@alamo.com with your rental agreement number and all the details of your experience. Thanks. -Chris R.

name: Betty Jo Williams
text:
excellent Service .Please asked for Angella Johnson or Andrena Bennett
Pick up -Was the best experience ever. Next day there was an issue and I had to bring the car back due to the battery light was on .I was afraid it would quit on me and I did not know the area. Came back they gave me another car and I drove off within 30 minute. Return the car on my way to the airport and the young lady waiting to accepted the car was so pleasant.I HAVE never rented from them but will in the future only
Great job .Ladies keep up the good service

name: April Bowen
text:
Picking up my car was almost a nightmare! The sales attendant was pushy, trying to tell me I needed a bigger more "comfortable" rental. I purchased the economy option because I was only driving 2 hrs. Even after explaining this to them, they still insisted. It was very annoying. I work in retail and I know companies require their employees to upsell but, no means no and they should've stopped at the first no.
Returning my car was easy and convenient.
Also, for 1st time renters... Beware of hidden costs and fees. I made that mistake. A $75 rental ended up being over $100. So, those reasons I gave Alamo 3 stars.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this to our attention Prila. We would like to look into this further. Please email Care@Alamo.com with your contact information, rental information and all the details above so we can address this situation. Thank you- Michael

name: Frances B. Walker
text: Kudos to Alamo for hiring Adrena Bennett to be a part of your team! My daughter, Candess  Broughton,  and I were in town for the home going service of a beloved family member.  Adrena was gracious in every possible way and making this interaction one of joy and encouragement.  Thank you Adrena!

name: Eileen Hillis
text: My experience with Alamo was as follows: efficient, friendly and fast, and a good value.  The car was great.  It had great pick up and got really good mileage per gallon of gasoline.

name: Michelle Fowler
text: Very pleasant and professional staff both at pick up and return. The no hassel check in on line as well as.the no hassle return was also great. Thank you for a great experience.

name: Donald Fish
text: It was good but you need a credit card and not a debit card

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Mr. Fish. If there is anything I can do to help, please email care@Alamo.com with the exact rental location, your reservation and/or rental agreement number(s), contact information, and the full details. Kind regards, Michael

text: Had the impression the older black lady helping us didn't like her job. Tried to tell us the compact car we rented wouldn't accommodate 2 people and tried to sell us an upgrade. Later found out, the compact car we rented wasn't available so they had to put us into a mid size car anyway. Travel a lot with work, my company will stick with Enterprise in the future!

text: Be careful!  I was talked into an upgrade and the total cost was $130.00 for one day!  The upgrade was suppose to be $25.00 but they failed to tell me that daily rate changed to a higher rate, too.  I thought I was paying $25.00 more on my original reservation price ---which ended up to be $70 more!  Yikes!

resp.text: Ms. Mclaughlin, we would like to look into this further. Please email care@alamo.com with your rental agreement number and all the details of your experience. Thanks. -Chris R.

text: Don't expect to talk to anyone at their front desk if you call them for anything after you rent the vehicle. Tried reaching them all day and got nothing but ring no answer, then stuck into their general mailbox each time. After several messages, still no call back. Its going to take a trip down to their office just to speak with them. Horrible customer experience.

resp.text: Aaron, we'd be happy to look into this. Please email care@alamo.com with your contact information, the rental agreement or reservation number, and all the details so we can research this promptly. name: Pen Jen
text:
My car rental was for 10:30 AM and I showed up at 9:45AM due to an earlier arrival on my flight.  I had a reservation for any size car, but the counter staff would not honor the reservation until 10:30.  They did however tell me that for between 80 and $150 dollars more for my 3 day rental, they could give me an upgrade on the spot.  I told them no and would wait until 10:30 to get my rental.  10:30 came and I got a vehicle for my quoted price that the counter folks would have charged me $100 extra to rent 45 minutes earlier.

Bait and switch is not pretty, especially not for a company I had used so often with good results.  Will not rent from Alamo at Huntsville again.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. If you can provide a few more details, I would be happy to look into this further for you. name: shaneka edwards
text: I rented a standard size vehicle a couple a weeks ago from Alamo and I must say the customer service I received was totally above what I expected. Adrena, the young lady at the service desk was great!!! I will continue to rent vehicles from this place only!!

name: Brett Crow
text: the line was long for pickup with only one agent working..I return to alamo as they consistently have quality cars  at reasonable prices...... .I am frequently frustrated with the inability to call the desk.  (have tried multiple times with multiple rentals...)  I left a CD in the player with my last return and didnt even try to call the desk as i know it would have been futile.

text: Place offered "discounts" through priceline, paid the down payment and the next day we got there and had to pick up at 6pm. We had $520 withdrawn from our account and had to wait 5 days for the refund. Huge headache and waste of time.

resp.text: Hi Devin , I would like to know more about your experience so I can help. Please email care@alamo.com and include the rental location, rental agreement or reservation numbers and your contact information. Thank you.-Christopher

name: Shanda Collette
text: This was one of the worst car rental experiences of my traveling life.  Got to the desk with a pre-paid reservation.  They did not have any cars that I had rented, when the desk gal called down and had the call on speaker, the girl on the other end was just plan rude to her co-worker, so much so, that the desk gal grabbed the phone off speaker.  So she decided to upgrade me, great right, wrong, I go out to the spot they tell me, there is not car.  So I go to the parking garage booth where they will do paperwork, and am told I need to go back to the airport desk, I'm like really, you want me to walk all the way back to the airport and to the desk and start this all over, well yes, so thats what i did.  Got there, went through the same thing again,  and then got a new car, went out to the spot looking for a White car, since that was what I was told it was, only to find no car in the spot, and then a very nice guy driving the help van, noticed that I had been there for a good hour at this point, contacted the Alamo manager, who wasn't much help, but did finally get me a car and I was finally able to leave the airport after an hour and half.  That is unreal.  Won't being using Alamo anymore especially in Huntsville.

resp.text: Shanda, we would like to look into this further. Please email Care@Alamo.com with your contact information, your reservation/rental agreement number, and all the details of your experience. Please include reference # 160901-000964 in the subject line of your email. Thanks. –Christina

name: Todd Tran
text: Great customer service at the airport...The selection of cars is not good, only one car for mid size was available

name: Jorge Maldonado
text: Well, in huntsville al, airport, the personnel were friendly, the car meeting my rental request was not available, had to wait for a car to be available. Originally,  I did rented for 3 days, for ~$72 total, $17.xx/day but decided to rent it for 2 more days, or extend my rental, called alamo in huntsville, and was asked to pay almost $70 per day for a total of ~$210. Called in the 800 number, and was told, ~224 total, so over 70 per day, all this because weekly rate versus weekend, was told nothing can be done, but I checked the rental ageeement and found extra day should be ~$42, rental agreement , it doesn't has a clause if applied on weekend or weekly rates, I asked why the contract is not honored, was told can't honor the contract, but have to use the alamo system and the system give a different price.  However I was told that one of the 2 days can be ~$17.xx, which I decided to take it.  Called again 800 number and was able to rented it for 5 more hours for $21 , in that way I could return it on the 4 day.  Conclusion,  each alamo loc follows different rules in regard to daily rates, rental contracts or agreements are not enforced according to my experience ,  remember customers renting your cars is the reason why your company exist, do your best to keep your customers.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Mr. Maldonado. If you’d like to discuss this further, please email Care@Alamo.com with your rental information and all the details above. Thank you, -Chris R.

The Cobbs Ford team is hands down superior to any other HERTZ in Montgomery.  We take good care of our cars and return them clean and full of gas in return for great service.  Nothing but speedy check out & returns with no hassle with this store!

Thank you HERTZ!

text: DJ was very, very rude and unprofessional.  Will never do business there again because of him and the piece of junk he gave us that was nothing close to what we reserved.

text:

Delbert Raiford

text: DJ is the absolute best! customer service just hit a 10.

text: The attendance was under the expectations. The car have worked well.

name: Briana Butler
text: I booked a car rental through Travelocity for tonight. I arrived at 5:30pm to pick up the rental and I walked up to two employees talking who did not even acknowledge me. After interrupting their conversation I showed the attendant my confirmation and she Informed me they have no cars available even though they clearly have a parking lot full of cars. I was told that my confirmation does nothing matter when it’s a third party reservation. I asked if anyone canceled any reservations because I saw all the cars available outside and she said no, not at this time. She then did not offer any other assistance or information that could help me find another rental option. I was given poor customer service at the desk then I had to call the third party on my own to cancel my reservation and found out that they could not do anything on their end until they confirmed with Avis that I did not in fact pickup a car. Unfortunately due to this situation I am still left without resolution or a refund for money paid toward this reservation. I highly do not recommend using this rental location. I also am dissatisfied With the customer service line for AVIS as it does not go directly to the location and is a recorded loop.

resp.text: Hello Briana, I'm sorry when you arrived at the location they were sold out of vehicles. All vehicles are based on their availability and if they don't have any vehicles you may have to look for a different location or rental company to get a vehicle. For the refund, since you booked with a third party agency you have to speak with them and they are able to call and verify you didn't get the vehicle to process a refund. ~Jasmine

name: Lisa
text:
Please do NOT rent from here!! They will make you pay for damages that you didn't cause. If you do, make sure to check the car you rent very carefully for any damages/scratches before you sign anything (ours wasn't even cleaned) otherwise they will scam you.
We now have to pay for damages that the previous renter did.
It was kind of our fault for not checking carefully, but after a long flight with a newborn we just wanted to get a car but as it turns out you cannot trust anyone anymore. Shame on them for treating a military member on their family visit like this. Save yoursefl the trouble with this highly unprofessional company and pay a little more somewhere else.

resp.text: Hello Lisa! Please email us your rental agreement number, name listed, email address along with the details of what happened to socialinfo@avis.com Please include SM#260800 as well.  ~RG

name: Anja Pledger
text: The staff was very polite and willing to help.

name: Lisa Headley
text: If I could give this company a minus 10 I would!!!!!!!! I booked a rental to be picked up today and after I had a reservation and paid for 39$ of insurance for today through Tuesday this company calls me the day of departure to inform me that they had no cars which stopped me from renting anywhere because it is so late! Do not rent from this company they will screw you over and act like it’s not their fault!!!!!!

resp.text: Hello Lisa, I'm sorry to hear to wasn't able to get the vehicle you had reserved. If you were able to get a vehicle with another rental company you can email us at socialinfo@avis.com with case number 217458, reservation number and the name on the reservation? ~jasmine

text: great customer service , i was a walk up when no one else accepted me and they got me in a car to get back with my family . would recommend any day and will be returning if possible,

text: Straight ghetto.. very unprofessional

name: T Jones
text: I lost 30min of my day sitting waiting for someone to help me while 2 employees sat in the back. I called several times and had someone else call. I never got an answer and they told my friend they were having a conference meeting, yet nobody came to the desk to help me. The agent at Enterprise knocked on the door TWICE to inform them that I had been waiting. The agent at Hertz walked through the airport to look for them after I stood at the desk for 15min but all the while they were there. Finally when someone did surface from the back, she was very short, unfriendly, and looked as if she had just awaken. I was returning a corporate rental. I work for a Fortune 500 company and will promptly inform them that I request that ALL future rentals for me be handled by some other rental company. If there was a sign stating when they would return or that they were in a meeting, this situation could have been avoided. This was a horrible experience from a customer service stand point. I FULLY understand why they have such a low ratings/reviews.

text:
The policies of this place are horrible. If I could give zero stars I would. The car I rented had battery problems causing it to die mutiple places requiring me to ask random people for jump starts. I finally got it to my hotel to hear that they won't come bring me a new one or at least drop off a battery. The kicker, the only way to return it if it's towed at my expense! Ridiculous.

Update: Avis ended up making it right and disciplining the employee. She had claimed to be the manager and lied through this difficult ordeal. They drove me out a car to my location and made it right. Overall crazy.

I'll stick to Enterprise from now on.

text: Really enjoyed renting from her, the customer service was excellent. Easy process entering and bringing back.. Will be coming back for next trip...

text: As a customer service worker, I was appalled to see how your employees treated a fellow service worker today.  I was dissapointed.  So glad I didn't have to rent a car today.  I would have called a cab before renting from y'all.

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Had to rent a car after a wreck. I was sure I would have to go all the way to Birmingham to pick one up. I was very happy to find out we had one here in Oneonta. They were nice and helpful. The gentleman made the process as painless as possible. Thanks guys.

name: Mary Chappell
text: Although they do not have a big selection of vehicles to rent the man handled my account efficiently and quickly. A+ place.

name: Trey Strawn
text: 3 weeks of phone calls to rental set up so that I can finally get my truck repaired. Today dropped off my truck called enterprise, and ???? itll b at least an hour, and no we dnt have a truck for u to rent, finally get picked up. Then... they somehow again lost insurance info. So I had to start all over with the calls to bth insurance companies to finally 2 hr later drive away with a shotty rental CAR. 1 star at best.

resp.text: Trey Strawn, I would be happy to look into this for you. Please email care@enterprise.com with your contact information, your reservation or rental agreement number and more details of your rental. Thanks. - DR

name: Chris Mahan
text: Great vehicles at reasonable prices. They also have locations everywhere, so returning the rentals is a fast and easy.

name: Trista Baker
text: Had a great experience fast and easy.  I was in and out less than 30 minutes.

name: canaan beavers
text: Everything explained to simplicity. Great service. Will rent from Oneonta Enterprise again if need be.

name: Pete Johnson
text: The manager did a great job in getting us a vehicle and helped us sort out a reservation snafu.

name: David VanRiper
text: I got in a car accident and was given a rental car but called them one day and they didn't have a car and tried to call the next day and they will not return my call very bad business

resp.text: David Vanriper, we would like to look into this further. Please email care@enterprise.com with your contact information, your reservation or rental agreement number and all the details of your experience. Thanks. Chris M

name: Ryan M
text: Booked a reservation for a business trip. Showed up to pick up the car and was told nothing was available. Never received a call to inform me of the issue so that I could plan accordingly.

name: Sarah Torgersen
text: LaRae was very professional and efficient.  My vehicle was ready as reserved.  One drawback is that this location requires the Insurance Declaration page vs. the standard Proof of Insurance card I have in my wallet.  I was able to download and email it in about 5 minutes, but it was unexpected.  Return process was easy.  I always stay to get my receipt, that way I am not surprised by charges.

resp.text: Thank you for the high rating, Sarah. We hope you'll give us the chance to earn your 5-stars during your future Hertz rental. -Alexandra

name: James Jaillet
text:
Seconding some reviews I've seen here: THE WORST.

Terrible service, for starters. Secondly, they charged me double the amount I was told it would be. Staff is unhelpful at best, really rude at worst. I'd avoid renting from this location if possible.

I had to sit and wait for nearly an hour the morning of my reservation (despite being the only customer there) because they required an obscure insurance documentation — rather than the standard proof of insurance card in my wallet that, for instance, you'd show a police officer at roadside. It made me an hour late to my destination.

After I dropped the car off, I pulled up my receipt online a few weeks later and realized I'd been charged double what they'd told me on the phone. They have a 24-hour policy and will charge you for two days if you don't return the car within 24 hours. I was not told this was the case; when I booked, I told them my plans for pick-up time and drop-off time, and they told me the price. Likewise, I told them when I'd return the car the morning I picked it up, and still no one said it would be a two-day charge. Lastly, when I dropped the vehicle off, no one told me I would be charged for two days.

I called to discuss the two-day charge with the staff and was met with rigidity, interruptions and hostility -- absolutely no care or concern for the issues at hand and, obviously, absolutely no attempts to rectify what I perceived as an intentional misunderstanding meant to charge me for two days instead of for the single-day reservation.

Lastly, this is a privately owned location, so any concerns you have cannot be addressed by the broader Hertz company.

resp.text: James, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review at Hertz Car Rental. We are sad to hear that we missed the mark this time, and would love the opportunity to hear from you! If you haven't already, could you reach out to us on Facebook Messenger at: m.me/hertz  Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. -Emily

name: Kelly Bringier
text: Very helpful & good svc. Good prices for the car we needed. Def will use again.

resp.text: Kelly, thank you so much for the review! I'm happy to see that you had a pleasant experience renting with us at Hertz Car Rental. We hope to serve you again in the future! #HertzTeam ~Nikeya

name: Julie Noles
text: The worst. Made a reservation for a car over a week ago. Time came to get the car and they say they have no cars. What was my reservation for? They said they did not have even one car on their lot. Not to mention we had been trying to call them for a week but no one ever answered the phone and they didn't check the multiple messages we left. No one wants this level of difficulty. It's ridiculous.

resp.text: Julie, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We hate to hear that you're disappointed with us. We'd like to make this right , please reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam~Nikeya

name: Dawn Rodgers
text: I have always rented from Enterprise.  And after this experience, I will never rent from Hertz.  State Farm set me up with Hertz after one of their customers hit me.   The office was a mess, papers scattered around on floor and table (get some filing cabinets). The male Hertz employee had a mouth of chew.  He literally spit his chew into a plastic coke bottle in front of me and my daughter.  I thought I was going to puke 🤮 I had issues with the vehicle they rented me.  I brought back to exchange.  No professionalism.  The girl just complained the whole time, slammed papers and pens on desk.  I understand having a rough day but you have to keep it together.  I would think twice before you rent from Hertz on Madison Blvd. in Madison.

name: Sara Robinson
text: Awful. Did not communicate well with the insurance company of the person who totaled my car & temporarily charged my card over $500 even though it was clarified upfront that I was not the financially responsible party. 0/10 Would not recommend.

resp.text: It's upsetting to see that we didn't provide you with the experience that we expect for our customers. Could you do me a favor and email us at: https://www.hertz.com/rentacar/customersupport/index.jsp?targetPage=contactUsView.jsp?CUS_key=2&CUS_keyText=A%20Past%20Rental%20-%20Billing%20Questions%20or%20Comments/Feedback&CUS_routing=P&CUS_category=CON_US_PAST_RENTAL so that we can have a better understanding of where we can improve? - Justin

name: Blake Hargrove
text: I was a little preturbed with this rental service. I called approximately 10 days in advance to check the availability of a certain type of vehicle. This rental involved my auto insurance, as I understand the process is different than a standard rental. Their staff I formed me they would be able to have the type of vehicle (small/mid SUV) I needed when I came to pick it up. When I showed up, I was I formed all I could get was a Sedan, or wait a few hours, and I could possibly get an SUV as originally requested.

name: Christy Poston
text: I have never experienced issues with this Hertz location. Its definitely better than Avis and Enterprise. I wish they were open longer on Saturdays but I will take what I can get 😉

name: Kimberly Elliott
text: Called to see about setting up a rental. I was put on hold for several minutes and then no one answered. I filled out the rental reservation form on the website with my insurance claim number, and they sent me a confirmation email. Went to pick up the rental, and they couldn't find my reservation. Horrible customer service. The guy was watching a video on his phone the entire time he was helping me. This was my first and last experience with Hertz.

name: Tim Townsend
text: Hertz has some messed up categories. We reserved a Chevy Equinox 6 cyl Crossover (car frame) and wound up with a Dodge Durango 8 cyl (on a truck frame).  The Durango weighs almost 2000 lbs more.  We were already at the Hertz site & had 2 choices, take the Durango or walk away.  We were ready for our trip so I took it.  Wow, the Equinox has 2 rows of seats while the Durango has 3 rows and rides heavy.  My wife was getting car sickness from the sway on turns on the interstate.  Hertz needs to reevaluate their categories as the Hertz rep told me the two are in the same category!!!

resp.text: Tim, thank you for leaving your review at Hertz.  We're disappointed to hear that you didn't have a great experience with us.  We'd like for you to reach out to us on Facebook Messenger: m.me/hertz. Our social customer care team would love the opportunity to review your experience. #HertzTeam

text: I rent from this location multiple times a month. The staff are very understanding and laid back. I highly recommend!

name: Dominic Moore
text: The team of mike and La'Nae are so awsome . they are very professional and helpful. I will refer them to all my family and friends

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! I'm happy to see that you had a pleasant experience renting with us at Hertz Car Rental. We hope to serve you again in the future! #HertzTeam - Justin

name: Robin Heath
text: Awesome and courteous service. Great price

name: Greta Strickland
text: Very pleasant experience, loved the staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the awesome feedback Greta! I am so happy our staff took great care of you and  we hope to service you again soon!  😊 -Justynne

name: Scarlet Pennrose
text: Horrible customer service. The guy up front gave me attitude when I was asking him questions about the pricing, because I had never rented a car before. They talked about using Hertz cars off the clock and laughed about it. Then he handed me the keys and said the car was out front. I said, "Okay. What car is it?" He said, "It's out front." I said, "There are 20 cars out front." He replied with, "Just click the button. You'll see it." Not cool.

name: Claudia Nowlan
text: The car was great....awesome service!!!

name: Aaron Lutz
text: Very easy to work with staff. They were the cheaper than enterprise. It was a $50 differece one way. I didnt like I was told all locations would be open for drop off but they were not. Next time renting a car will most likely go through them again.

name: Steve L
text: Very pleasant employees.

resp.text: Steve, It's such an honor to receive positive feedback from our customers.  Our goal is to always provide our customers with an all-around stellar experience. Glad to hear that  we met your expectations, and created great memories with you. We look forward to seeing you soon!~Emily

name: Jan Waldrom
text: Awful service, incompetent manager!  Car was being repaired at repair shop.   I called for a week to reserve an SUV and was asked repeatedly to call back every 12 hrs or so to see what they had. Evidently,  no system exist  for tracking in/out coming cars.  Never had answers, just a bunch of I don't knows.  Extremely unproffessional.  Went some where else.

name: April Goodmon
text: 1 star because it won't let me leave 0. The absolute worst service. I had a car accident and my insurance company sent my rental car reservation there. It was right before closing so, I called first thing the next day, the day of my sisters wedding, and was told I would get a call back. An hour later, the lady calls me back and asked what kind of box truck I was wanting. When I explained that I needed a rental car and to be picked up, she said that was a whole other inventory and she needed to call me back, again. She never called me back.

name: Lillian Hardley
text: Great custom service.

name: Brett Millar
text: Great People and Service.

name: Carly Lee
text: Never rented a car until I got one here...what a pleasant experience. I will be back.

name: Michael C. Hayes
text: Great service

name: Wayne
text: Small place with a small selection, but the people there really worked hard to help me out when I was in need.

name: Jonathan Blackwell
text: Worst experience I have ever had with a rental company. The customer service was terrible, and it is clear to see that they are unorganized. The 1 male working the desk was helpful and offering solutions when needed (not the problem), meanwhile the 1 lady was rude and disrespectful the entire time, and any question I attempted to ask was interrupted with a short, snarky answer. Along with this, I was given a car with many faults (cigarette ashes all throughout interior, oil light turned on as soon as I cranked vehicle, tires with barely to no tread), but was offered nothing in return and could not exchange the vehicle like I was told via telephone. Finally, I asked for a driver but after 45 minutes did not have one and had to walk to the shop in a thunderstorm to collect my vehicle before they closed. If you want an experience that adds more stress and irritability to your day by completely wasting it, this is the perfect place to go.

name: Sellers, Alex
text: Always been there when I need to travel at the last moment. Great staff. Management team does their all to put you in: YOUR affordable, best fit for you/family/friends accomodations and comfortability. Your needs for local or long haul no matter they make it easy. Thanks again Hertz in Northport. You make it possible for me and my Daughter to stay just within reach.

name: Sharai Kraus
text: Prepaid for a cargo van to be picked up at 10:00AM. I called their office at 9:00 as I realized that I would be running late. I was told that they did not have the cargo van but anticipated that they would have it before they closed at 4:00. I am guessing they weren't planning on calling me to let me know that the van wasn't there.  The representative told me she would call back and let me know when the van arrived or what another option would be. When I called back at 2:30 they said they only had a minivan. I agreed because I needed a vehicle.   When I arrived I could not pick up the van because they needed the card I used to reserve it, unfortunately that card was at my home over an hour away. They told me that was the only option and no I couldn't use a different card, they had to have the original card. So I wasn't able to rent a vehicle, but got a pamphlet to call billing on my own to get a refund.

name: Ashleigh Robinson
text: After paying $400 to rent a vehicle I went to pick the vehicle up and was told i had to pay an additional $500 deposit plus a credit check. This was not disclosed in my agreement. Then they told me the credit card that I used to rent the vehicle could not be used for the security deposit. Keep in mind this is the same card where they already took $400 from. The staff was rude and they were no help at all. Not only that, my mom rented a vehicle as well and they told her the same thing. But the vehicle she rented, they gave away to another person and didn’t have any other vehicle that met her specifications. She rented a 7 passenger vehicle and they had none to accommodate her reservation. I will never rent from hertz again!!!!! If i could give 0 stars I would

name: Lucas Fox
text: An absolute joke of an experience. Put on hold for 15 minutes with no answer. A reservation set for 2:30 and 2 hours later have heard nothing from the store. You’d be better off trying to rent a car from North Korea

name: Johnny H
text: Terrible service. They overbooked and ran out if cars to rent to people leaving some people stranded without a car. Manager was rude and short tempered. Got angry when confronted about her’s and the companies terrible service. Did not even try to help me find another place to rent from nor make it up to me with a simple apology. If you are going to rent a car from here, don’t. Just go to Birmingham and save yourself so much time and stress.

name: Jason Rushing
text: Arrived to pick up my reservation and they didn't have the vehicle.  Didn't bother to call me just waited until I arrived to tell me. Headed out of town on vacation without the suv we need and all they say is this happens sometimes.

name: Adam LARKE
text: Worst experience ever. Flew in from out of state with an online reservation at this location. Arrived on time to be told they do not have cars available. No offer of a solution. How do you take reservations without cars? I was told to go back to my hotel and they would call me if they got a car back. Needless to say that never happened. Do not rent from this location.

resp.text: Hi, Adam. We certainly do not like to see that you didn't have a five-star experience with our Tuscaloosa AL location. We will be passing on your valuable feedback to local management for review and we thank you for taking the time to leave us a review and providing this feedback. - Travis

name: Willie Spencer
text: It was great like always. The manager and staff are very professional 😁 that's my spot

name: Dustin “Shnoz” Hebert
text: The staff here are absolutely amazing. Helped my wife and I while our car was in the shop and it's the best deal in town

name: Harper Elixir
text: When I arrived the SUV I had reserved was already taken. I was offered a pick up truck. I accepted the offer because I was told it would be around the same price as the SUV.  I was charged significantly more on my final receipt than what I initially signed up for. I did extend the rental for a day, but also used my military discount. There were no damages to the vehicle, I’m pregnant,  so no smoking, and I even filled the gas tank up completely. Called the location I rented from and an associate took my information down for the manager to contact me about crediting my account.  No one has called.

name: Anthony Hodge
text: Bad customer service. Nasty cars

resp.text: Hello, Anthony. We certainly don’t like to see that you didn’t have a five-star experience with us and would like to review your concerns. Can you please send us a message at (m.me/hertz) So we can further assist you there. Thank you. - Travis

name: Matthew Unruh
text:
It was alright. Everyone was nice but the teller took a personal call mid-transaction and the car we got was moldy and a bit banged up. They told us we wouldn't be charged but I had to call Hertz customer service directly to verify that.

All in all it worked out.

name: Bryce Eller
text: Marcus really helped me out. Super friendly staff, stayed late for me, and I got to meet an ex NBA player. Overall wonderful experience

name: DeRoscio Bogan
text: I've only had one experience with this place, but it was a great one. Professionalism at its best. Kristy Noland was very courteous and went beyond her means to make sure I got the right fit for what I needed and the prices are the best I've seen anywhere around West Alabama. I really appreciated the great service!

name: Londyn Brown
text: Very poor customer service. Very nasty attitudes. The car I reserved was not available when I arrived to pick it up. I was given false information over the phone. I would not reccomend.

name: Michael Vaughn (Whiteboy)
text: See this is one I need to come back to because it should be a two part. When I return the car and have no issues with anything then they get 5 Star  all day

name: Hassan Abrams
text:
I am a Presidential Circle member and I have been renting vehicles from the Tuscaloosa location for years now. Now, with every establishment there will be issues.. We can't judge the inner working of an establishment unless we understand the people and the stresses they may endure.. Customer service is not just the company, Customer service is us as customers too...We must treat the staff like we want to be treated...Respectful.
With that being said, I, myself have had ups and downs with this location. After getting to know CHRISTIE NOLAND and the Branch Manager MARCUS, I totally understand their position, the company position, and my position as a very frequent customer.
If a vehicle is returned by a customer or Company that didn't abide by their lease agreement, I can't service my potential customer with an adequent vehicle. If my location doesn't have fleet of vehicles and present customer haven't returned or extend their rental agreement, I must continue to keep them happy, despite I may have to explain to my future customers the inconvenience of not having their rental ready; even if I reserved the vehicle.
I believe through my experience with the Tuscaloosa Hertz location, they work extremely hard trying to accommodate from the pleasant to the most outrage customers.
That is why I rate them a 10, because they try their best to accommodate everyone even though, they may be limited with vehicles, staff, or support from their Corporate office.
In closing, I will say this... Enterprise is individually owned, with a car wash on site, but I know Hertz renders better Customer Service than them, especially here in Tuscaloosa. I am a former Enterprise Customer and I would never go back to the Skyland location.

resp.text: Hassan,Thank you for the kind words! We love to continue providing great service to awesome customers like you. Thanks again! 😃 -Alexandra

name: Nanci Mascarenas
text: Great customer service! I had to keep the car an extra day and it was no problem at all. Thank you, Hertz T-Town!

name: Skyla Jones
text:
This company stole extra money out of our account claiming that there were damages. When we told them we took pics that were time stamped and dated when we got the car that already had damages. Then they changed and said oh maybe there were Ashes. We asked for the pics they claimed to have,considering I’ve never smoked in my life!!! Not to mention no need to start now since I have stage 3 kidney disease.
Then we asked for the manager and a young guy Kept saying hold please. Never got the manager.  When I dropped the car off nobody looked over the car.  People were outside smoking. Laughing, eating and doing whatever.  Because due to covid you can’t go in. This company wonders why they filed bankrupt.  But we reported them to the attorney generals office for charging fake chargers.  And for never getting us those pics. Of the smoking. Got to enterprise or Avis. They don’t have criminals working there.

resp.text: Skyla , all feedback from our customers is very important to make improvements for our company to provide the best service. We want to let you know that this type of experience is certainly not a common practice of our company and we would in no way want you to feel that this is the case. Please be assured your message will be shared with the proper team in hopes of preventing this from occurring in the future. ~Elyse

name: Kanita Sturdivant
text: I returned the car. They never checked the car in Tunis 11 DAYS LATER when they charged me almost $1000 for a 3week rental. It should’ve been around $550. Instead of putting back the money they weren’t supposed to take, they just paid the difference days later. Do NOT spend your money here. Do not patronize with these people. Hertz is trash

name: Scuba Steve
text: By far the worst rental company you can deal with had nothing but issues with them and the people that work there are all rude.

name: Marz B.
text: They took care of me and it was an overall good experience.

name: Traci Jackson
text: Highly recommend!  Marcus took good care of us, recommended the right vehicle for our needs and gave us a good deal on it even though it was not what I had originally booked.

resp.text: Traci,  thank you for taking the time to write such a great review for us at Hertz Car Rental! We're delighted you had a great experience with our staff and hope to serve you again soon! -Emily

name: Nikia Worsley
text: Worst experience EVER! I prepaid for a vehicle online. Get to the office and they tell me I can’t get the vehicle because I don’t have a major credit card. So I call corporate to try and get a refund and they gave me the run around for about two weeks straight saying they reversed my transaction and sent it back to my bank. Turns out they still took my money, never reversed the transaction, and I had to end up filing a dispute with my bank. I will NEVER do business with Hertz again.

resp.text: Hello Nikia, thank you for reaching out regarding your experience with us. We certainly would like our team to look into this experience further, if you could please message us via our Facebook link at m.me/Hertz. Thank you! -Bob

name: Robert Ilijason
text: Really supportive staff but they are not supported by the best IT systems. It was cheaper for me to book online while in their office and wait for the confirmation mail to arrive. The people on site were really good though.

text: Car was great, no problems.  Pricing is fair compared to the others. They did not wash the car which most of us business travelers expect.  Not a deal breaker for me though. I will say that there was quite a bit of complaining among the workers and customers could hear it.  I find that very distasteful. But car was good.

name: C Porter
text: Staff is  helpful ,

name: Sofia Kourtidou
text: Very nice Peoble, give's you lot's of Information. Good Car's and good Price's. Thank you though.

resp.text: Sofia,  thank you for taking the time to write such a great review for us! We're delighted you had a great experience with our staff and hope to serve you again soon! -Emily

name: F Davignon
text: Prepaid for a vehicle from this Hertz through orbitz.  The pickup time was scheduled for 9am I arrived at noon only to be told that they did not have any vehicles. I asked what happened to the vehicle that I had already paid for and they said it was given to someone else because they assumed I cancelled the reservation.  No one called me to check and see if I was coming or not. They just gave my car away without checking with me after I had paid in full.  Then they told me I had call orbitz to get a refund because orbitz charged me not hertz. This was not the case because the charge was from hertz not orbitz and the agent from orbitz had to call this store to actually reverse the charge. I do not recommend renting a car from this location.  Go somewhere else that will honor their reservations.

resp.text: F, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review at Hertz Car Rental. We are sad to hear that we missed the mark this time, and would love the opportunity to hear from you! I'm told their system should not have let me make the reservation but they didn't even attempt to contact me regarding the unavailability.

resp.text: Sean, we regret that we did not meet your expectations during your rental experience. We have high standards that we strive to maintain and would like to review these concerns. Please reach out to our social customer care team at  m.me/hertz Thank you!~Nikeya

text: Issues with the first car they gave me but they fixed me up with a different car and sent me on my way in a quick and friendly manner.

name: Jeremy Taylor

resp.text: Jeremy, thank you so much for the review! I'm happy to see that you had a pleasant experience renting with us at Hertz Car Rental. We hope to serve you again in the future! #HertzTeam ~Nikeya

name: Melissa Marie

name: Glenn Tootle
text: I have rented from this location numerous times and have always been treated GREAT! Super nice staff. Car was ready when I arrived. Clean. Full of fuel. Easy to return. Again.....the staff at this location has been AWESOME!

name: Stephanie Jones
text: My insurance company reserved a car for me. I went to pick up the car and they didn't even have one for me. Their excuse was they had 20 reservations already. Poor Service! Go to Enterprise! Wonderful service and will go out of their way to help you!

name: Ali Alhishan
text: Really bad store. I went there in the morning with a reservation and the told me we don’t have any available car for u. Seriously!!?

resp.text: Ali , all feedback from our customers is very important to make improvements for our company to provide the best service. Please be assured your message will be shared with the proper team in hopes of preventing this from occurring in the future. ~Alexandra

name: april Brown
text: So I went to rent a car and they tells me I can’t rent because of credit; just when does your credit have to be great to rent a car I don’t understand. I have never ever heard of this I’m so loss but they just lost my business totally.

name: John Bennett
text: I have been a presidential gold member with Hertz for several years.  Their service has been extremely good and satisfying. I highly recommend Hertz to my friends and anyone who desire exceptional professional rental car service.

name: Michelle Webb
text:
Hands down best Hertz I have been to. Christy  the young lady who checked me in, had everything prepared before I even walked in!
She was so friendly, and helpful and did it all with a smile. She also helped me after the fact when the drop off location had some issues ( unrelated).
5 Stars to this ....and only this.... Hertz location!!!

name: Deborah C. Kim
text:
Want to give ZERO star rating for this place. The past three employees - (I do not hold any opinion over current employs- were extraordinarily rude, arrogant, and unprofessional. (At least one of them is still there, surprisingly.
To Michelle Webb: the same employee you praised - Christy -  was the one of the distasteful employees I have ever had to deal with in Tuscaloosa. She took forever to find my online reservation. She didn't know how to use the computer. I even brought the printed copy of the reservation ticket for proof, yet she blatantly told me that the reservation is void since she didn't find it on the computer. She seemed to be uneducated in how to identify her own company's online service. I did online reservation to save time, but she made it so much more difficult than it should be. It took about an hour to find the reservation, and another hour just to get the car. The car also showed that the employees were lazy and nonchalant in their work. Like other reviews, the car was FILTHY AND SMELLY. Interior was not vacuumed nor exterior was washed clean.
To be honest, I was treated badly once, and that one time is more than enough for me to criticize and deny future business UNLESS I know Hertz is working on improving their flaws. Giving cheaper price for a service doesn't give you the right to get cheap with how you treat customers. Be Warned! Don't go to Hertz here. You'll regret it. You will waste your money, time, effort, physical and mental stamina. Save yourself from the trouble.

name: Nick Zark
text: Very helpful staff. Quick, friendly service.

name: B Paul Radu
text: Experience was acceptable overall but started out very horrible. This was a small Hertz center and did not have accommodations to pick me up at the time I needed but they did knock off cost for taxi services. Customer service was excellent. Vehicle was very nice, upgraded but not clean at pickup so that kind of balances out. In future I will probably go with a bigger company to avoid the stress.

name: Donald Howard
text: Poor service when I rented last year. Customer service was not interested in solving problems. When I tried to rent this year , the attitude seemed the same. I am a Hertz  #1 gold member and have rented from Hertz all over the country and have not had problems anywhere else.

name: Lex Smith
text:
I spent over 10 minutes on hold for this lady to check on my reservation. When she finally returns to the phone, she didn't remember that she was supposed to be checking on my reservation. I ask about it again and she laughs and goes, "Yeah, we got your reservation (laughs). You know, there's a $50 security fee." I say okay and was about to ask her about the car, but she says "Yeah, okay." and hangs up.

At this point, I'm questioning whether or not I should even get this car. They never called to confirm the reservation or anything, and the rep I talked to was rude. I hope the car does not turn out to be as bad as some of these reviews.

name: Linda Mc
text: DO NOT GO HERE!! Had an insurance rental here and the car I got smelled so bad from cigarette smoke that we couldn't breathe so we called back and asked to switch out, they said that was fine so we went over there with the impression everything was ok. We got there and they said I needed to fill the car up even though I had signed for the no fill option. When I left to fill the car up my daughters stayed in the office and apparently the manager didn't realize they were there and started talking about me and the vehicle they were giving me. "There's nothing wrong with that car but she's going to be in a world of hurt with this other one". The agent I was working with said she didn't hear him and assured me the car was safe. I was extremely mad at the unprofessionalism of the manager and worried about the safety of the car so I decided to call corporate to make them aware of the attitude of their employee. Apparently being unprofessional is company wide because they never returned my call either!!

name: Dave W
text: Guys at the counter were very helpful.  However, who ever it is that cleans the cars before you get them left food in the center console storage compartment. I found it after searching for the bad smell for a while. They need to be more thorough when cleaning a car.

text:
Never did I think that renting a vehicle could be such an enjoyable experience. Alex went above and beyond. The whole process was very smooth.

In reading some of the other reviews, I was surprised to see so many low ratings. I’m left wondering if these folks went to the same place I did? Not to invalidate anyone’s experience, but I think this can probably be explained by the fact that usually, when someone is renting a car, it’s because something went wrong (e.g. car troubles), so they’re likely not in a stellar mood to begin with. I guess it’s easy to take it out on Enterprise in a Google Maps review. Honestly, I have a hard time believing that most of those negative reviews are deserved because again, Alex and his team went above and beyond to ensure that this process was not only painless, but actually enjoyable.

name: FTVALLEY93
text: I made a hasty reservation online.   I was called a few minutes later and asked if I needed a ride to the location by "Jonathan" who stated he was working to accommodate my reservation.  I had a a ride already but the gesture showed their wanting my return business.  The team at the Palisades location seemed to be will managed and I was pleased with the speed in which I which I was serviced.   Jonathan provided me with a vehicle that was a level above my expectations and really made me feel like my platinum membership was worthwhile. However I found that they are just as accommodating to nonmember customers seeking their service.   My vehicle experience was fantastic and the price was even more  pleasing to my pocket.  I will continue to be a long term customer at this location because of the staff, management and the experience of being made to feel special.  I would like to thank them all and invite you to experience the same good feelings as I had there.

name: Kenneth Smith
text: Great respect to social distancing!

name: Rachel Ankersen
text:
I rented a Toyota Corolla from them for 2 days. I drove it like the safe careful driver I am, filled up the tank, returned it to the location. As I sat in the waiting room, the man inspecting the car says: "ma'am are you aware a hubcap is missing?" Of course I'm not aware...because I didn't hit anything. He calls the Toyota Dealership and they quote him $75 to replace it. And I guess I, as a paying customer, am expected to just accept my bad luck, pay it as if I'm made of money, and not say a damn thing. To me, a hubcap should not just pop off with normal driving and, if it does, it's because Enterprise staff have not been seeing to it that the car doesn't have loose parts. When we did the original walk around inspection, I was led to believe that we were looking for physical damage to the car - no more, no less.

Manager said I have two options: pay the $75 or file it on insurance. I said there is nothing else that can be done? He said they could call around other places for other estimates but they have a "special relationship" and that's probably the best price they could get...so basically no. At that point I was like "screw it" and I said we're done with this conversation - and he stormed off. Because I guess that's what managers are supposed to do when a customer is upset. That's what I was...a customer...not a blithering idiot driver that rags out someone else's car because I have no respect for the property of others. I was a customer...but I'm not anymore.

I would advise anyone else renting a car with them to get down in the dirt and make sure the hubcaps are on securely. I didn't do that, Enterprise sure as hell never did (and never will for their customers) and a bill that should have been $52.50 was $134.84.

resp.text: Ms. Ankersen, I would be happy to look into this for you. Please email care@Enterprise.com with the exact rental location, your reservation and/or rental agreement number(s), and the full details of concern. Kind regards, Michael

name: Nikki Macon
text: We are a corporate account. We spend on average 3,450 dollars a month renting cars from this Homewood location. The customer service is absolutely absurd. Over the last 3 months they have lost reservations, just didn't deliver cars at all, said they didn't have any cars and couldn't help us at all, and they have delivered cars with maintenance lights on.  On three separate occasions cars have ended up breaking down or getting a flat tire due to the maintenance needed, and caused some of our employees to be stranded on the side of the road. They have delivered cars with cracked windshields, scratches, and rim issues and tried to blame our employees for the issues. After voicing concerns in a nice manner, these problems still continue to occur. As if things couldn't get much worse,  they have started closing their office early and leaving customer phone calls in the queue beginning at 5pm when they close at 6. IF ANY OTHER Enterprise location could service the Homewood area, we would be taking our business elsewhere. DO NOT USE this location if you don't have to.

name: JOHN DURKIN
text:
Worst customer experience I’ve ever had:
- I made an online reservation but not only was the vehicle not the same type as reserved but it wasn’t ready when I arrived
- After I made the online reservation, o still had to sit in the office for an hour while they took down all my details and cleaned the car
- The employee who “helped” me did not help. He never explained the process or what was happening, he never volunteered any information and was monosyllabic when I asked him questions. Near the end of the interaction, he was almost rude

To sum: Enterprise stinks at transitioning an online experience to an in store one. They need to do a basic job of explaining their processes and laying out customer expectations. And have the cars ready when you show, or at the very least be willing and able to explain to me why there is a delay. Without me having to ask.

I will rent cars again, but not through Enterprise.

If you would like to discuss this further, please email the details above along with your contact information, the rental office and rental agreement number to care@enterprise.com. -Chris R.

I had to initial that I did not accept the other 2 forms of insurance, but it seemed like their was really only one place to initial about the insurance and I think this might have just said I declined it even though I paid for it. Do not understand the 3 different levels between the insurance???

name: Chris Justice
text: I have rented from enterprise all over the country, airports and branches. I have purchased cars for my dealership through their remarketing department. I never had an issue until I went to the one in Homewood. D. Matthew McCoy the mgr. asked me for a utility bill and a check stub. He said he was doing me a favor, normally he asks for 2 bills. Is this a new policy or just in the black areas? #matthewmccoy said I have to prove to him I pay my bills. SMH. I have received different responses from Enterprise, they seem scripted. One response claimed it was the bank card I used. However I have always used the same debit card. I was paying for the complete one day rental up front plus deposit. Why would they need to see if I pay my bills on time, I'm not buying the car. I have used that card all over the country with Enterprise with no problems. Very disappointed.

name: Valerie Gaines
text: Great car rental service. They are more than happy to help you in any situation. The office on 3rd Ave in Birmingham, AL has great customer service and Angela is a very valuable asset to the company. My son in law and I picked up our vehicle on Friday 8/3. He rented a Toyota Corolla and I had a Jeep Compass and it was nice and roomy. The only downside of it was the "A" ( not sure what it was for, didn't check). When it's on, and you brake, it feels like the car cuts off and when you take your foot off the brake, it  feels like the car cranks up again,  so I was constantly turning it off. But back to the service I received,  the office was just opening and they were crowded.  Angela took her time with each customer and was very polite and at the same time assuring the other customers she will get with them shortly and thanking them for their patience. She was the only one working and she worked diligently with all the customers and kept a smile and great tone!

name: Ben Schultz
text: Posting this in the car rental side because if they are anything like the truck rental they are putting people in danger!:  THEY DON'T INSPECT THEIR VEHICLES STAY AWAY!!! This was the worst experience that I have ever had with a company ever. I didn't believe the horror stories until I experienced it myself. Used their truck rental to move to Colorado over the summer. made it 20 minutes out of Birmingham then the truck broke down, took them 4 hours to send someone out to get it fixed. once we got back on the road it broke down again 10 minutes later. After another 5 hours of waiting on the side of the road in 95 degree weather for them to send someone out to "fix," another issue. Also they didn't bring any water we requested for us or my dog who was overheating. So after all that they barely got the truck to run, we got to drive to denver with a blinking check engine light, worst most anxiety inducing drive of my life. This also forced my gf to miss her job interview, thanks budget! Of course we asked for a refund for being placed in a dangerous and horrifying situation. Budget offered less than a 10% refund, a slap in the face after everything we went through. Do not rent with this company!! They will probably respond to this review with some bs response saying how they value their customer experience or something DONT LISTEN. This company will put you or your family in a dangerous situation, leave you and all of your stuff stranded for hours without help, and then not give the slightest bit of care or concern because their reputation is already horrible. Please please please put in some extra money for a UHAUL or Penske its worth every penny!
